gt:
Heat oven to 375F.
Mix cream cheese product and bacon bits until blended.
Separate each can of dough into 8 triangles.
Cut each triangle lengthwise in half.
Spread each dough triangle with generous 1 tsp.
cream cheese mixture; roll up, starting at short side of triangle.
Place, point-sides down, on baking sheet.
Bake 12 to 15 min.
or until golden brown.
Serve warm.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix together the Philadelphia Herb & Garlic Cream Cheese Product and the Oscar Mayer Real Bacon Bits.
3. Roll out the crescent dinner rolls on a lightly floured surface to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
4. Cut the crescent rolls into triangles using a sharp knife or a crescent roll cutter.
5. Place the crescent roll triangles on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Spread the cream cheese and bacon mixture evenly over the top of the crescent roll triangles.
7. Bake the crescent rolls in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the crescent rolls are golden brown and the filling is melted and bubbly.
8. Remove the crescent rolls from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Cream Cheese-Bacon Crescents!

gt:
Mince the garlic and onion and cut the sausages into easy to eat pieces.
Put the oil and garlic into a frying pan and fry until aromatic.
Add warm rice and butter to the pan and fry.
When it becomes crumbly, add the onion, sausages and the corn from the can minus the liquid.
Fry it all together.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper, drizzle the soy sauce from the sides of the pan and fry well.
You're done!
pred:
To cook a delicious Corn and Sausage Fried Rice with Butter Soy Sauce, follow these steps:

1. Prepare the ingredients:
- In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
- Add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
- Add the cooked rice and stir to combine.
- Add the canned corn, stirring to mix well.
- Add the sausages, breaking them into smaller pieces if necessary. Cook until the sausages are browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
- Season the dish with salt and pepper to taste.

2. Cook the dish:
- Add the soy sauce to the skillet, stirring to combine.
- Add the butter, stirring to melt and combine with the soy sauce.
- Cook the dish over medium heat until the rice is heated through and the sauce has thickened slightly.

3. Serve the dish:
- Serve the Corn and Sausage Fried Rice with Butter Soy Sauce immediately.

This delicious Corn and Sausage Fried Rice with Butter Soy Sauce dish is a satisfying and flavorful meal that can be enjoyed by people of all ages. The combination of rice, corn, sausages, and the rich flavors of the butter soy sauce creates a delightful and comforting dish that is perfect for lunch or dinner.

gt:
Prepare the noodles according to package directions.
Meanwhile, heat the oil in a deep skillet set over medium-low heat.
Add the garlic and hot pepper flakes.
Cook, stirring often, for 2 minutes or until fragrant.
Add the kale and broth; cover and cook for 3 minutes.
Uncover and stir in the hot cooked noodles.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add extra broth to moisten as needed and adjust seasonings to taste.
Serve immediately.
pred:
1. In a large pot, bring the chicken or vegetable broth to a boil.
2. Add the NO YOLKS Broad Noodles and cook according to the package instructions until they are tender but still firm to the bite.
3. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, minced garlic, hot pepper flakes, and salt and pepper.
4. Once the noodles are cooked, reserve one cup of the cooking liquid and then drain the noodles.
5. Return the noodles to the pot and pour the olive oil mixture over them. Stir to combine.
6. Add the baby kale leaves and cook until they are tender but still vibrant in color.
7. Season the dish with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Serve the NO YOLKS Garlicky Noodles with Kale immediately.

This recipe combines the convenience of store-bought noodles with the nutritional benefits of kale, creating a delicious and satisfying meal. The garlic and hot pepper flakes add depth of flavor, while the chicken or vegetable broth provides a rich and comforting base. The result is a well-rounded and flavorful dish that can be enjoyed by people of all ages.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Unroll dough into 6 wedges on lightly floured surface.
Put one slice of ham on widest end of each dough wedge and top with slice of cheese, tucking in any that hangs over the edges of the dough.
Roll the dough tightly into crescent shape.
Place rolls on cookie sheet and bake until golden brown, about 12 minutes.
Remove from oven and brush tops with softened butter.
Serve immediately.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the crescent roll dough and 1 egg. Knead the dough until it becomes smooth and elastic.
3. Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
4. Cut the dough into 6 equal portions.
5. Place each portion of dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Spread a thin layer of butter on top of each piece of dough.
7. Sprinkle each piece of dough with a pinch of salt.
8. Place a slice of cheese (or good quality Swiss) on top of each piece of dough.
9. Top each piece of dough with a slice of lean smoked ham (thin slices).
10. Bake the croissants in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
11. Remove the croissants from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before cutting them into halves or quarters.
12. Serve the Easy Ham and Cheese Croissants warm.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
Prepare the brownie mix per the package directions.
The product I used called for the one egg and 1/4 cup of oil but use whatever additional ingredients are required by your package.
Pour into a greased 9x9 pan.
Put all of the topping ingredients into a clean bowl.
Blend and create crumbs with a fork.
Spread the topping mix evenly over the brownie batter.
Bake at 350 F for 30 minutes or until the brownies are your desired level of done.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the brownie mix, eggs, oil, and any additional water as per the instructions on the box. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the quick oats, flour, cinnamon, and peanut butter to the mixture. Stir until well combined.
4. Pour the batter into a greased 8x8 inch baking pan.
5. Bake the brownies in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
6. Allow the brownies to cool in the pan for about 10 minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
7. Once cooled, you can add a layer of powdered sugar or drizzle melted chocolate over the top for extra flavor.

Enjoy your delicious Peanut Butter Crumb Topped Brownies!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
Mix ground beef, onion soup mix, egg, and evaporated milk together.
The texture should be very mushy with a lot of moisture.
(6 oz.
evaporated milk is usually enough but you could use a 12 oz.
can, adding as you mix and save the leftover evaporated milk).
Form meat mixure into a loaf and place in a baking pan.
Bake until meat is done, about 45 minutes.
Drain off some of the excess juice/grease.
Top meatloaf with the jar of gravy; put pan back in oven to heat gravy through, about 5 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground beef, Lipton Onion Soup Mix, egg, and evaporated milk. Mix well.
3. Shape the mixture into a loaf and place it on a greased baking sheet.
4. Bake the loaf for about 1 hour, or until a meat thermometer inserted into the center of the loaf reads 160°F (70°C).
5. While the loaf is baking, prepare the gravy according to the package directions.
6. Once the meatloaf is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
7. Use a spatula to transfer the meatloaf to a serving platter.
8. Pour the gravy over the meatloaf and serve immediately.

[/INST]

Please note that these are general instructions and may vary depending on the specific recipe or cooking method. Always follow the recipe provided for the best results.

gt:
Bring the broth to a boil in a large heavy saucepan over medium-high heat.
Mix orzo in and simmer uncovered until just tender but still firm to bite and some broth still remains, stirring occasionally, about 8 minutes.
Remove from heat.
Add green onions and cheese and stir to blend.
Season with salt and pepper.
Rewarm if necessary, over low heat and mix in more broth by 1/4 cupfuls if pilaf is dry.
Transfer to a large bowl and serve.
pred:
1. In a large saucepan or pot, combine the chicken broth, orzo pasta, and salt. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the orzo is cooked through and tender.

2. While the orzo cooks, heat a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Add the green onions and cook for about 2-3 minutes, or until they are softened and slightly browned.

3. Remove the cooked orzo from the saucepan and transfer it to a serving bowl.

4. In the same saucepan, add the grated parmesan cheese and stir until it is melted and smooth. Pour the melted cheese mixture over the orzo and toss to combine.

5. Serve the Orzo Pilaf immediately, garnished with additional green onions if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Choose 2 pumpkins approximately the size of small serving bowls.
Slice the tops off the pumpkins and remove the seeds.
Sprinkle with salt and roast in a 350 degrees F oven for 30-40 minutes until the flesh of the pumpkins is soft.
When the pumpkins are cooked, add the oil, onion and garlic to a pot and saute for a few minutes until translucent.
Add the rice and stir to coat.
Raise the heat and add a half cup of the stock.
Lower the heat to medium and stir until most of the stock is absorbed.
Add another half cup of stock and continue stirring and adding stock until the rice is cooked and creamy.
Cooking risotto requires frequent stirring and should take around 30 minutes.
Scoop most of the cooked flesh out of each pumpkin and stir it into the risotto until blended.
Add the cheese and fresh herbs and season to taste.
Pour half the risotto into each pumpkin, top with its lid and serve hot.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Clean and peel the pumpkins, then cut them into small pieces.
3. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and sauté until softened.
4. Add the minced garlic and continue cooking for an additional minute.
5. Add the rice to the pot and stir to coat it with the oil and onion mixture. Cook for a minute or two, until the rice is slightly toasted.
6. Pour in the chicken stock, one cup at a time, stirring constantly to ensure the rice is cooked evenly.
7. When the rice is almost fully cooked, add the grated Parmesan cheese and stir until it is melted and incorporated into the rice.
8. Add the diced pumpkin pieces and stir to combine.
9. Cook for a few more minutes, until the pumpkin is tender and the rice is cooked through.
10. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
11. Remove the pot from the heat and stir in the chopped parsley.
12. Serve the Pumpkin Risotto immediately, garnished with additional parsley if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
For the marinade, mix olive oil, vinegar, oregano, sugar, salt and pepper, feta and cayenne.
Marinate chicken in half of marinade.
(Set the other half to the side.)
Marinate for 1 hour.
Grill chicken at 350-400 degrees F for 8-10 minutes until chicken is cooked through.
Pour the other half of the marinade over the cooked chicken and let steep in for 1 minute before slicing to add to pitas.
Assemble pitas: add chicken, lettuce, tomato, tzatziki dip, and feta cheese to the pita shells.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chicken, olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, sugar, salt, and pepper. Mix well, then cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
3. Meanwhile, prepare the pita shells by brushing them with olive oil and sprinkling them with salt and pepper.
4. Place the chicken mixture on the pita shells, dividing it evenly among the four pita shells.
5. Top each pita with a dollop of tzatziki, a slice of tomato, and a sprinkle of feta cheese.
6. Bake the pita party in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the pita shells are golden brown.
7. Serve immediately and enjoy!

gt:
Combine graham cracker crumbs with melted butter and press on the bottom of a 9" springform pan.
Beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth.
Add eggs one at a time and mix until just blended.
Stir in zest and juice from lemon.
Pour mixture into crust and bake at 350 degrees for 45 to 50 minutes or until center is almost set.
Cool completely, then refrigerate for a minimum of 3 hours.
Top with Cool Whip and garnish with lemon slices.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (160°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, and sugar. Mix until well combined.
3. Press the crumb mixture evenly onto the bottom and up the sides of a springform pan.
4. Bake the crust for 10-12 minutes, or until it is set and slightly golden.
5. Allow the crust to cool completely before adding the filling.
6. In a separate mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese until smooth.
7. Add the sugar, one cup at a time, beating well after each addition.
8. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
9. Add the lemon juice and zest, and mix until well combined.
10. Pour the filling over the cooled crust.
11. Bake the cheesecake in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until the center is set and the edges are slightly golden.
12. Allow the cheesecake to cool completely in the pan before refrigerating for at least 4 hours or overnight.
13. Once the cheesecake is completely chilled, top it with Cool Whip.

gt:
Spoon cooked rice into greased 3-quart casserole.
Layer broccoli over rice.
Melt butter in saucepan.
Remove 2 T. butter and sprinkle over bread crumbs in a bowl.
Set aside.
Saute onion in remaining 4 T. butter.
Blend in flour, salt and pepper.
Slowly stir in milk.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until thickened.
Add ham and heat until bubbly.
Pour into casserole.
Layer cheese over ham mixture.
Sprinkle on crumbs.
Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked rice, broccoli, and onions.
3. In a separate bowl, beat the butter or margarine until softened. Add the breadcrumbs and mix until well combined.
4. In a small bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, and pepper.
5. Add the milk to the large mixing bowl and stir until the rice and vegetables are well coated.
6. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top of the casserole.
8. Pour the beaten egg over the top of the casserole.
9. Sprinkle the breadcrumb mixture evenly over the top of the casserole.
10. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the breadcrumbs are golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. Remove the casserole from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Harrington's Favorite Ham and Cheese Casserole!

gt:
Mix all ingredients, except the chicken wings, in a bowl.
Add the chicken wings and marinate for several hours.
Preheat oven to 350F.
Remove the wings from the marinade.
I discard the marinade and do not baste the wings during cooking.
Roast in the oven for 30 to 40 minutes in a, shallow and parchment paper lined, baking tray.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix together the crushed garlic, cayenne pepper, ground ginger, and salt.
3. Add the chicken wings to the bowl and toss them to coat them evenly with the spice mixture.
4. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
5. Spread the wings out on the prepared baking sheet, making sure they are not overlapping.
6. Drizzle the orange juice and rind over the wings, ensuring they are evenly coated.
7. Dust the wings with dark brown sugar and honey.
8. Roast the chicken wings in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the skin is crispy.
9. Remove the wings from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your Orange Wings, a delicious and flavorful dish!

gt:
In a mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs, oil, vanilla and pineapple.
Add to the dry ingredients until blended.
Fold in the zucchini, cranberries and nuts.
Pour into 2 greased 9 inch pie pans.
Bake at 350* for 30-35 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean.
Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans then cool completely on wire racks.
Just before serving, dust with powdered sugar.
Yield: 2 cakes, 8 wedges each.
(Can also be baked in one greased loaf pan for 40-60 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean).
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract.
4. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until just combined.
5. Add the zucchini, cranberries, and chopped walnuts to the batter. Stir until just combined.
6. Grease a baking sheet with cooking spray or oil.
7. Pour the batter onto the prepared baking sheet, spreading it evenly.
8. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes on the baking sheet, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Once cooled, dust the cake with powdered sugar.

Enjoy your Cranberry Zucchini Wedges!

gt:
Season the pork with salt and pepper and rub it in well.
Bring to room temperature.
Finely chop the carrots.
Take off the thin roots of the bean sprouts and diagonally slice the green onions.
Chop the cabbage and green peppers, then slice the onion into wedges.
Combine the sauce ingredients.
Blanch the vegetables.
Boil water in a pot, add a pinch of salt and a tablespoon of oil, then add the hard vegetables.
Don't add the green onions, bean sprouts, or wood ear mushrooms.
When the green peppers become a vibrant green, drain the vegetables.
Be careful not to over-cook.
Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a frying pan and add the meat.
When the meat is about 80% cooked, add the green onions, garlic, and ginger and stir-fry until fragrant.
Drizzle the Shaoxing wine around the sides of the pan.
When the alcohol has evaporated, add the douchi.
Then, add the vegetables and bean sprouts.
Stir for about 15 seconds, add the sauce, and mix it all together.
After about another 30 seconds of stirring, the bean sprouts should be good, so add the katakuriko slurry to thicken it up.
Drizzle 1 tablespoon of sesame oil, toss, and enjoy!
pred:
1. Prepare the ingredients:
- Wash and chop the cabbage, green pepper, green onion, carrot, and wood ear mushrooms into bite-sized pieces.
- Wash and peel the garlic and ginger, and slice them.
- Rinse the pork shoulder roast and pat it dry.
- Drain the bean sprouts.
- Crush the douchi and katakuriko slurry.
- Slice the sesame seeds.
- Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl.

2. Prepare the stir-frying pan:
- Heat the stir-frying pan over medium-high heat.

3. Cook the stir-fry:
- Add the pork shoulder roast to the pan, and cook until it is browned on all sides.
- Add the bean sprouts, green pepper, green onion, carrot, and wood ear mushrooms to the pan. Cook until the vegetables are tender but still crisp.
- Pour in the Shaoxing wine, and stir to deglaze the pan.
- Add the douchi and katakuriko slurry, and stir to combine.
- Cook for a few more minutes, until the sauce has thickened slightly.
- Add the garlic, ginger, and sesame oil, and stir to combine.
- Cook for a few more minutes, until the flavors have melded together.
- Season with salt and pepper to taste.
- Serve the stir-fried meat and vegetables over rice or noodles.

[/INST]

gt:
Cut cabbage in eighths.
Place each piece of cabbage on a piece of aluminum foil large enough to wrap around entire piece of cabbage to leave no openings.
Before closing foil and 1 tablespoon of butter to each piece of cabbage and salt and pepper to taste.
Wrap in foil, make sure there are no punctures in foil.
Place on grill and left cook for 30 minutes or until tender, not mushy -- enjoy.
pred:
1. Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
2. Wash the green cabbage thoroughly and remove any loose leaves.
3. Cut the cabbage into bite-sized pieces and place them in a large bowl.
4. Add 1 tablespoon of salt and 1 tablespoon of pepper to the cabbage. Toss the cabbage to coat it evenly with the seasonings.
5. In a small bowl, mix 8 tablespoons of unsalted butter.
6. Spread the butter mixture evenly over the cabbage pieces.
7. Wrap the cabbage pieces in aluminum foil, making sure to seal the edges to prevent any spills during grilling.
8. Place the wrapped cabbage on the preheated grill and cook for 20-25 minutes, or until the cabbage is tender and slightly charred.
9. Remove the cabbage from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Grilled Cabbage!

gt:
In large fry pan cook celery and onions in grease or oil and water over low for about 1/2 hour.
Put bread, sage, salt and pepper in large bowl.
Pour onion/celery mix (including liquid) over bread and mix well.
Beat eggs and add to bread mixture.
Mix well.
Put dressing in greased baking dish and bake about 45 minutes in 350 oven, covered.
Doubles well, extremely good cold.
Can be made in well greased crockpot on low in about 3 hours.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cubed Pepperidge Farm Herb Stuffing, chopped onion, and chopped celery.
3. Add the sage, salt, and pepper to the bowl, stirring to combine.
4. In a small bowl, whisk together the bacon grease or cooking oil and water.
5. Pour the liquid mixture into the large mixing bowl with the stuffing ingredients, stirring to combine.
6. Add the four whole eggs to the bowl, stirring to incorporate.
7. Mix the ingredients until well combined and the stuffing is moistened.
8. Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
9. Bake the stuffing in the preheated oven for about 30-35 minutes, or until it is golden brown and cooked through.
10. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious My Grandma's Heirloom - Thanksgiving Stuffing dish!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350.
In a large bowl mix the cake mix, beaten eggs, melted butter, and chocolate chips.
Stir all together and then spread in 9x13 pan; bake for 20-25 min.
Then enjoy with a glass of ice cold milk!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the melted butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the chocolate chips and cake mix until well combined.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients (flour, baking powder, and salt) to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
6. Spread the batter evenly in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the bars comes out clean.
8. Allow the bars to cool completely before cutting into squares and serving.

[/INST]

These Lazy Chocolate Chip Cookie Bars are a delicious and easy dessert that can be prepared in no time. The combination of melted butter, chocolate chips, white cake mix, and eggs creates a rich and moist texture, making them a perfect treat for any occasion.

gt:
Heat grill to medium heat.
Mix first 3 ingredients until blended.
Spray grill with cooking spray.
Add chicken and pineapple.
Grill pineapple 2 min.
on each side.
Remove from grill; set aside.
Reserve half the barbecue sauce mixture for later use.
Grill chicken additional 15 min.
on each side.
Brush chicken with half the remaining barbecue sauce mixture; grill 10 min.
or until done (165F), turning and brushing with remaining barbecue sauce mixture after 5 min.
Remove from grill.
Brush chicken and pineapple with reserved barbecue sauce mixture.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the BULL'S-EYE Original Barbecue Sauce and Sriracha sauce.
3. Season the chicken with salt and pepper.
4. In a large bowl, toss the chicken in the sauce mixture.
5. Place the chicken on a broiler pan or baking sheet.
6. Roast the chicken in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).
7. While the chicken is cooking, prepare the pineapple rings by slicing them into 8 pieces.
8. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into pieces.
9. Place the pineapple rings on a baking sheet and broil them in the oven for 5-7 minutes or until they are slightly charred and caramelized.
10. Serve the chicken and pineapple rings together, garnished with fresh cilantro if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Mix flour, salt, soda, sugar and butter.
Put in egg and sour milk and mix well.
Turn out onto a breadboard and knead it a little, then put in a pan and bake.
To a nice golden brown in a 350 oven 25-30 minutes.
pred:
[INST]
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, salt, baking soda, and sugar.
2. Cut in the butter using a pastry blender or your hands until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
3. Add the egg and sour milk, stirring until the dough comes together.
4. Turn the dough onto a floured surface and knead until it is smooth and elastic, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Place the dough in a lightly greased bowl, cover it with plastic wrap, and let it rise in a warm place until it has doubled in size, about 1-2 hours.
6. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
7. Punch down the dough and transfer it to a lightly floured surface.
8. Roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.5 cm).
9. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
10. Place the shaped dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
11. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
12. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a saute pan combine diced tomatoes, one can of the green chilies, onion and shredded chicken.
Cook over medium heat until most of the liquid has cooked out.
To make the sauce: In a blender combine the sour cream, salsa, cilantro if using and the rest of the green chilies.
Blend until smooth.
Pour about 1 cup of the sauce into the bottom of a greased 13x9 pan.
Set your flour tortillas on a work surface.
Take about 2 tablespoons of the chicken mixture and place into each of the flour tortillas and roll them up.
Place the rolled tortillas on top of the sauce in the pan, seam side down.
Pour the remainder of the sauce on top.
Cover the pan with a sheet of foil and bake for 35 minutes.
Then remove the foil and top with cheese.
Bake for an additional 10 minutes.
pred:
To craft Chicken Enchiladas with Pineapple Salsa, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).

2. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add the diced onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.

3. Add the shredded chicken and cook until browned, about 5-7 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

4. Add the drained and rinsed canned diced green chilies and continue cooking until the chicken is fully cooked through.

5. In a small bowl, mix the sour cream and pineapple salsa.

6. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked chicken, sour cream mixture, and any additional seasoning you prefer.

7. To assemble the enchiladas, place a tortilla on a flat surface. Spread a layer of the chicken mixture on half of the tortilla. Roll the tortilla over the filling, sealing the edges with a little water or a dab of butter. Place the enchilada seam-side down in a baking dish. Repeat with the remaining tortillas and filling.

8. Pour the enchilada sauce over the enchiladas, covering them completely.

9. Bake the enchiladas in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the sauce is bubbly and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

10. Serve the Chicken Enchiladas with Pineapple Salsa on the side, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Chicken Enchiladas with Pineapple Salsa!

gt:
preheat oven to 350
slice pepper and onion
cut each breast in half and seer both sides but do not cook all the way through it will finish cooking in the oven
after chicken is seered cut into cubes and place in bowl with onions peppers and bbq sauce to coat the ingredients well
grease a medium cake pan well.
in separate bowl mix cornbread as directed on the boxes.
pour cornbread into greased cake pan making sure it spreads evenly.
spoon on the bbq chicken and vegetables evenly over the cornbread mix
sprinkle desired amount of cheese on top and bake for 20 min or until cheese is melted and the cornbread is cooked through
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chicken breasts, bbq sauce, and shredded cheddar cheese. Mix well to ensure the chicken is evenly coated with the sauce.
3. In a separate mixing bowl, combine the corn bread mix, milk, and eggs. Mix until well combined.
4. Spread the corn bread mix evenly into the bottom of a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
5. Pour the chicken and cheese mixture over the corn bread.
6. Add the green pepper and onion on top of the chicken mixture.
7. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the corn bread is golden brown.
8. Let the casserole rest for a few minutes before serving.

This step-by-step guide will help you prepare a delicious BBQ Cheddar Chicken Casserole over Cornbread using the provided ingredients. The casserole combines the flavors of the bbq sauce, chicken, cheddar cheese, corn bread, green pepper, and onion, resulting in a satisfying and filling meal.

gt:
Drain the tofu and put into a heatproof dish.
Combine the ingredients and pour it into the dish from Step 1.
Steam in a steamer for 10-15 minutes.
Devein and boil the shrimp in hot water with a little sake (not listed in the ingredients), then peel the shells.
Heat the ingredients for the ankake sauce.
When the egg tofu from Step 2 is cooked, top with the ankake sauce, edamame, and shrimp from Step 3.
pred:
1. First, prepare the ingredients by washing and peeling the egg, cutting the tofu into bite-sized pieces, and removing the shells from the edamame.
2. In a large pot, combine the dashi stock, salt, and katakuriko slurry. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 10 minutes.
3. While the broth is cooking, heat a non-stick pan over medium heat. Add the tofu pieces and cook until they are golden brown on both sides, flipping them occasionally.
4. In a separate pan, cook the shrimp until they are pink and cooked through.
5. In a small bowl, whisk the egg until it is smooth and slightly frothy.
6. Carefully pour the whisked egg into the simmering broth, stirring gently to combine. Cook the egg mixture for about 2 minutes, or until it reaches the desired consistency.
7. Serve the Steamed Egg and Tofu in bowls, garnished with chopped green onions and a drizzle of soy sauce, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 180 C and line 2 baking trays with parchment paper.
Set trays aside.
Place the butter and sugars in a large bowl or in the bowl of your stand mixer.
Cream the butter and sugars together until light and fluffy.
Add in the vanilla extract and egg and mix until well combined.
Add in the flour and bicarbonate of soda.
Mix until well combined.
Chop up your Rolo candies and add them to your mixture along with the chocolate chips.
Mix until the chocolate chips and Rolos are evenly distributed.
Using an ice cream scoop, place cookies on your baking tray, 12 to a standard tray.
Place in the oven for 10-12 minutes.
I have quite a big cookie scoop, Ive been searching for a smaller one for ages, so for me they took 12-15 minutes.
However, I should have taken them out a few minutes earlier.
They should look slightly cracked on top and be golden brown, but still be soft and look a little under-baked.
When done remove them from the oven and allow them to cool completely before placing in an airtight container.
Will keep for up to 4 days.
Recipe adapted from Martha Stewarts cookbook titled Cookies.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugars until light and fluffy.
3. Add the egg and vanilla extract, and mix well.
4. Gradually add the flour, baking soda, and milk, mixing until a smooth dough forms.
5. Chop the Rolo candies into small pieces.
6. Roll the dough into small balls, and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
7. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
8. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Rolo Cookies!

gt:
chop small onion.
mince bacon.
saute these together
mix all ingredients
just simmer in pan 10 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot, cook the bacon over medium heat until it is crispy. Remove the bacon from the pot and set aside.
3. In the same pot, cook the onion over medium heat until it is soft and translucent.
4. Add the ketchup, mustard, brown sugar, and pork and beans to the pot. Stir to combine.
5. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Add the crispy bacon back to the pot and stir to combine.
7. Transfer the mixture to a large baking dish.
8. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes, or until the pork and beans are tender and the sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened.
9. Serve the Kossman Pork and Beans hot, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Place rice, onion, egg, milk, sage, bouillon granules and pepper in a bowl, stir to combine.
Add turkey and mix with your hands.
Place mixture in a a loaf pan.
Combine honey, vinegar and mustard.
Spoon 1/2 the honey mixture over the turkey and bake 30 minutes.
Spoon the remaining honey mixture over the turkey and bake 20-30 minutes or until done.
Let sit 5-10 minutes before slicing.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground turkey, cooked brown rice, minced onion, egg, milk, and beaten egg. Mix well.
3. Add the chopped fresh sage, chicken bouillon granule, black pepper, honey, balsamic vinegar, and Dijon mustard. Mix until well combined.
4. Shape the mixture into a loaf and place it on a baking sheet.
5. Bake the loaf for 1 hour, or until a meat thermometer inserted into the center of the loaf reads 165°F (74°C).
6. Remove the loaf from the oven and let it rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

This flavorful Turkey Loaf With Balsmic Honey Mustard is a delicious and satisfying meal that can be enjoyed by both vegetarians and meat-eaters alike. The combination of ground turkey, cooked brown rice, and a variety of herbs and spices creates a hearty, filling dish that can be served as a main course or as a side dish. The addition of the balsmic honey mustard adds a tangy, sweet, and savory flavor that complements the other ingredients in the loaf. This recipe is easy to follow and can be customized with various herbs, spices, and condiments to suit individual tastes.

gt:
Preheat oven 425 Fahrenheit
Wash chicken.
Check for pen feathers.
Add to a roaster or baking pan, you could do this in a crock pot.
Mix the lime sauce.
Make sure the margarine is soft squeeze the lime getting the pulp.mix everything well.
Cut the onion into quarters add sauce to inside of chicken.
Coat the onion pieces.
Put onions inside of chicken cavity.
Under the skin of the chicken breast gently get the sauce up under the skin.
Then coat the whole chicken, on the outside also.
Add the broth without washing any sauce off chicken.
Add your mixed vegetables.
Bake for 1 hour 40 minutes.
Baste after the 1st hour.
let sit 5 minutes.
Serve I hope you enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the chicken, lemon juice, salt, pepper, sage, and granulated garlic powder.
3. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken mixture and cook until browned on both sides and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes per side.
4. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, add the onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
6. Add the mixed vegetables and cook until they are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
7. Add the chicken broth and bring the mixture to a simmer.
8. Return the cooked chicken to the skillet and cook for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
9. Serve the 1 lime chicken over rice or noodles, and enjoy your delicious meal!

gt:
Pour all ingredients into a blender, starting with the beans at the bottom.
Blend thoroughly, making sure beans are chopped up and well incorporated.
If the mixture is too thick, blend in small amounts of water until desired thickness is reached.
pred:
1. First, rinse the canned sweetened azuki beans and drain them.
2. In a blender, combine the rinsed beans, cinnamon, and sweetened yogurt.
3. Add water, if desired, to achieve the desired consistency.
4. Blend the mixture until smooth and creamy.
5. Pour the mixture into a glass and enjoy your delicious P'at Lassi!

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Place 1 tbsp butter in a 9 inch square or 10 x 6 inch pan.
Melt in the oven about 3 minutes.
Beat together eggs, milk, basil, salt, onion, and pepper.
Add your filling from above.
Stir in 3/4 cup grated cheese.
Pour into baking dish.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Bake 35- 40 minutes until centre puffs up and is firm.
A knife inserted near the centre comes out clean.
Let stand 5- 10 minutes before serving.
Don't under cook as it will be runny and don't over cook as it will be dry.
Makes about 24 squares.
You can prepare a day or 2 ahead and reheat in oven for a few minutes until warm.
pred:
To prepare Crustless Quiche Square, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, basil, onion flakes (or sauteed onion), salt, and pepper to taste.
3. Add the shrimp, crabmeat, ham, bacon, broccoli, mushroom, and cheese to the mixture, stirring to combine.
4. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x9 inch baking dish.
5. Bake the quiche in the preheated oven for about 30-35 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is slightly jiggly.
6. Allow the quiche to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into square pieces.

The essential ingredients for Crustless Quiche Square include 6 eggs, 14 cup milk, 12 teaspoon basil, 1 -2 tablespoon onion flakes or 14 cup sauteed onion, salt, pepper to taste, and a variety of your choice of protein (shrimp, crabmeat, ham, bacon, broccoli, mushroom, or cheese). These ingredients will provide a delicious and satisfying quiche that can be enjoyed by people of all ages.

gt:
Peel back the husks of each ear of corn, leaving them attached at the bottom.
Remove the corn silk strings around the kernels.
Return the husks back around the corn.
Soak corn in a bowl of lukewarm water for 1 hour.
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
Mix salt and lime zest together in a bowl.
Remove corn from water and peel back husks, keeping them attached at the bottom.
Pat corn dry using paper towels, leaving the husks wet.
Brush the corn with melted butter and sprinkle lime salt and chili powder over the entire surface of each cob of corn.
Cook corn on the preheated grill, turning occasionally, until tender, about 25 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
2. Remove the husks and silk from the corn, leaving the corn on the cob intact.
3. In a large bowl, combine the melted butter, lime zest, sea salt, and chili powder.
4. Brush the corn with the butter mixture, ensuring that each ear is evenly coated.
5. Place the corn on the grill, and cook for about 15-20 minutes, or until the corn is tender and slightly charred.
6. Serve the grilled corn immediately, and enjoy!

gt:
Shell (leave the tail on) the hrimp and devein.
Heat a skillet on medium heat.
Add butter and garlic.
When it starts to smell garlicky, add shrimp and stir until it turns pink.
Add zucchini, saute and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
When it's cooked, pour the soy sauce over.
Remove from the heat, and sprinkle with chives.
Squeeze over lemon juice if you like!
With rice!
it was Yummy~
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the shrimp, butter, minced garlic, zucchini, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
3. Spread the shrimp mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
4. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the shrimp is cooked through and the zucchini is tender.
5. In a small bowl, mix the soy sauce, lemon juice, and to taste.
6. Pour the sauce over the cooked shrimp and zucchini mixture.
7. Toss the mixture gently to coat evenly.
8. Serve immediately.

This cooking tutorial provides a simple and delicious recipe for Soy Sauce Shrimp Scampi. The combination of shrimp, zucchini, and soy sauce creates a flavorful and satisfying dish that can be enjoyed by people of all ages.

gt:
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl.
Whisk milk, egg, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, maple syrup, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves together in a separate bowl.
Stir milk mixture into flour mixture until just blended.
Heat 2 teaspoons vegetable oil on a griddle over medium heat; pour about 1/4 cup batter onto the hot griddle.
Cook until bubbles begin to form on top of pancakes, 3 to 5 minutes.
Flip and cook until second side is golden brown, 3 to 5 more minutes.
Repeat with remaining batter.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, egg, and vegetable oil.
3. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until a smooth batter is formed.
4. Add the maple syrup and ground cloves to the batter, stirring until well combined.
5. Heat a non-stick frying pan or griddle over medium heat.
6. Pour a small amount of batter onto the pan, spreading it evenly to form a thin pancake. Cook for about 2 minutes, or until the edges are slightly browned and the pancake is cooked through.
7. Flip the pancake and cook for an additional 30 seconds.
8. Repeat with the remaining batter, adding more oil to the pan as needed.
9. Serve the Spiced Maple Pancakes warm, drizzled with additional maple syrup if desired.

[/INST]

gt:

I took my hand and broke up COLD RICE so it was in individual kernals before I began .....

gt:
Cook pasta according to the package directions.
In a large skillet, brown the sausage over medium-high heat.
Drain, reserving 2 teaspoons of the drippings, and set aside.
Reduce heat to medium.
In the same skillet, saute the onion and garlic in olive oil and the reserved drippings until the onions just begin to brown.
Add the wine and bay leaves, bringing the mixture to a boil over medium heat, then turning the heat to medium-low and simmering until reduced by half.
Stir in the chicken broth, the winter squash, half of the sage, and the cinnamon and nutmeg.
Continue to simmer over low heat for 2 or 3 minutes.
Add the half and half, salt and pepper, and transfer the sauce to a food processor or blender and process until smooth.
Return sauce to the skillet and stir in the sausage and pasta.
Cook and stir over low heat until heated through.
Before serving, sprinkle with Romano cheese and the remaining sage.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large pot, cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
3. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced onion and sauté until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
4. Add the garlic and continue to cook for another minute, until fragrant.
5. Add the sausages to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the sausages from the skillet and set aside.
6. In the same skillet, add the white wine and bring to a boil. Cook until the liquid has reduced by half.
7. Add the bay leaves, chicken broth, and cooked winter squash puree to the skillet. Stir to combine.
8. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 20-25 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the flavors have melded together.
9. Season the sauce with salt, pepper, and nutmeg to taste.
10. Return the cooked sausages to the skillet and stir to combine.
11. In a small bowl, mix the cream, sage, and ground cinnamon. Pour the cream mixture over the sausage and sauce, stirring to combine.
12. Cook the mixture over low heat for another 5-7 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the flavors have melded together.
13. Serve the Winter Squash and Sausage Penne over cooked pasta, garnished with shredded romano cheese.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Winter Squash and Sausage Penne!

gt:
Cover corn with water; let stand 30 minutes.
Drain.
Remove husks from corn; discard husks.
Scrub silks from corn; set corn aside.Prepare grill.Place corn on grill rack; cook 25 minutes or until corn is lightly browned, turning every 5 minutes.
Cool.
Cut kernels from ears of corn to measure 2 cups.
Set kernels aside; discard cobs.Cut bell peppers in half lengthwise; flatten with hand.
Discard seeds and membranes.
Place bell pepper halves, skin sides down, on grill rack.
Cook 20 minutes or until blackened.
Place in a zip-top plastic bag; seal.
Let stand 15 minutes.
Peel and finely chop to measure 3/4 cup.Combine corn, bell peppers, and remaining ingredients in a medium bowl.
Cover and chill.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 450°F (232°C).
2. Remove the corn from the cob and cut it into 1-inch pieces.
3. Cut the red bell peppers into 1-inch pieces.
4. In a large bowl, combine the corn, red bell peppers, minced parsley, lemon juice, jalapeno pepper, and salt.
5. Spread the mixture onto a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the corn is tender and the red bell peppers are slightly charred.
6. Remove the mixture from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Using a fork, mash the corn and red bell peppers together, creating a coarse texture.
8. Serve the Roasted Red Pepper-and-Corn Salsa immediately, or refrigerate it for later use.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Slide the pork slightly as you align them on your workplace.
Place shiso leaves and leek on top (as above).
Sift flour lightly with a tea strainer.
Wrap up tightly (press out any air).
Heat a modest amount of vegetable oil in a pan.
Roll the pork wrap around and cook until brown.
Add sake and cover the pan.
Steam-fry over low heat for 2 to 3 minutes (the leek will cook thoroughly).
Mix the butter and soy sauce with the pork wrap to finish.
Slice into bite-sizes and enjoy.
pred:
1. Preheat a pan or griddle over medium heat.
2. In a small bowl, mix the pork with the sake, and set aside for a few minutes.
3. In another small bowl, mix the flour with the soy sauce, and set aside.
4. Heat a small amount of butter in the pan or griddle.
5. Add the pork mixture to the pan, and cook until the pork is browned and cooked through.
6. Remove the pork from the pan and set aside.
7. In the same pan, add a small amount of butter and cook the shiso leaves until they are wilted.
8. Place the pork on the shiso leaves, and top with the cooked shiso leaves.
9. Brush the pork with the soy sauce mixture, and place the pork back in the pan.
10. Cook for a few minutes until the pork is fully cooked and the soy sauce mixture has been absorbed by the pork.
11. Serve the Leek & Shiso Pork Wraps with Soy Sauce and Butter immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
In a medium pot, stir the sugars, cornstarch, and cocoa powder until well combined.
Slowly whisk the milk and half-and-half into the mixture, then bring to a boil, whisking vigorously until thick.
Whisk in the chocolate chips and butter until fully incorporated and smooth.
Whisk in the vanilla.
Pour into a heatproof bowl.
Cover the surface with plastic wrap and refrigerate 4 to 8 hours.
pred:
1. In a medium saucepan, combine the 1/4 cup of granulated sugar, 1/4 cup of light brown sugar, and 2 tablespoons of cornstarch. Whisk to combine.
2. Gradually pour in the 2 cups of whole milk, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming.
3. Add the 2 cups of half-and-half, and continue stirring until the mixture thickens.
4. Add the 2 cups of cocoa powder, and stir until the mixture is smooth and well-combined.
5. Add the 1 cup of chocolate chips, and stir until they are melted and well-incorporated into the mixture.
6. Add the 1/4 cup of unsalted butter, and stir until it is melted and well-incorporated into the mixture.
7. Cook the mixture over medium heat, stirring constantly, until it reaches the desired thickness. This may take a few minutes, depending on the heat and the amount of liquid in the mixture.
8. Remove the saucepan from the heat, and let the pudding cool for a few minutes.
9. Pour the pudding into individual serving bowls, and refrigerate until it is fully chilled and set.
10. Serve the chilled chocolate pudding, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Toast your bread, butter it but not too much so its not soggy, put your seasonings on and dice into bite size pieces and you now have emergency croutons!
:)
pred:
Emergency Croutons Recipe:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Cut the two pieces of bread into small, even-sized cubes.
3. In a small bowl, mix the garlic salt, Italian herbs and seasoning, and real butter.
4. Toss the bread cubes in the butter mixture until they are evenly coated.
5. Spread the bread cubes out on a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy.
6. Remove the croutons from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your homemade Emergency Croutons!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350.
Cut ends off the eggplants/aubergines.
Make an opening for the stuffing by using a sharp knife and slicing the eggplant from the stem end down to the other, make sure that you don't cut them all the way through.
In a skillet, heat 4 tablespoons of olive oil over a medium heat.
Fry the eggplant gently.
If needed, you can add some more oil in the frying pan.
Remove the eggplant from the skillet and place in an 8"x8" baking dish.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Add the remainder of the olive oil to the same skillet.
Sautee the onions and garlic in it until they are slightly golden being careful to not burn the garlic.
You want the vegetables soft.
Add the fresh tomatoes and half a cupful of water to the skillet.
Add the oregano, sugar, more salt and pepper.
Simmer covered, for 15 minutes.
Remove stuffing from heat.
Fill the eggplants with this stuffing.
They will be slightly open as they don't need to be closed back over the stuffing mixture so be very generous.
Bake for 4O minutes; basting them at least once.

2. Cut the eggplants in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and membranes.
3. In a large bowl, mix the eggplants with the olive oil, onions, garlic, tomatoes, water, oregano, sugar, salt, and pepper.
4. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for about 1 hour or until the eggplants are tender and the filling is cooked through.
5. Serve the stuffed eggplant hot, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.
