This recipe for Imam Baildi Aka Stuffed Eggplant is a delicious and flavorful dish that combines the tender flesh of eggplants with a rich and savory filling. The combination of the eggplants, onions, garlic, tomatoes, and oregano creates a hearty and satisfying meal that can be enjoyed as a main course or as part of a larger dish. The addition of sugar and salt enhances the overall taste, while the pepper adds a touch of spice. The dish can be served hot, making it an excellent choice for a warm and comforting meal.

gt:
1.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl, stirring well to combine.
Cover and chill at least 1 hour before serving.
pred:
1. Cook the brown rice according to package instructions.
2. While the rice is cooking, prepare the vegetables by washing and peeling the zucchini, carrot, and plum tomato. Cut the carrot into bite-sized pieces and the zucchini into small, bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large bowl, combine the cooked brown rice, corn kernels, grated carrot, diced red bell pepper, green onions, red onion, cilantro, lime juice, canola oil, minced seeded pickled jalapeno peppers, kosher salt, chili powder, and black pepper.
4. Stir the ingredients well to combine.
5. Add the black beans and stir to combine.
6. Serve the Southwestern Confetti Salad immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

This Southwestern Confetti Salad is a delicious and healthy side dish that combines the flavors of the southwest with the freshness of the vegetables. The combination of brown rice, corn, zucchini, carrot, red bell pepper, green onions, and cilantro creates a vibrant and colorful salad that is both visually appealing and satisfying to eat. The addition of black beans and pickled jalapeno peppers adds a unique twist to the dish, making it a versatile and flavorful option for any meal.

gt:
Heat oil in large pot over medium-high heat.
Add shallots, ginger, and garlic and let cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
Stir in peanut butter, turmeric, cumin, and curry paste and let cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Whisk in water, coconut milk, lime zest, brown sugar, and salt until combined.
Add tofu, sweet potato, and kale, and bring to a boil.
Let simmer, covered, for 30 minutes, or until sweet potatoes are fork tender.
Stir in lime juice and adjust seasoning to taste.
Garnish with cashews and serve over rice or quinoa.
pred:
[INST]To prepare Vegetarian Panang Curry, follow these steps:
1. Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the shallot and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
2. Add the ginger and garlic, and cook for another minute.
3. Add the peanut butter and cook until melted and smooth, stirring constantly.
4. Stir in the turmeric, cumin, red curry paste, and lime zest. Cook for 1 minute.
5. Pour in the water and coconut milk, and bring the mixture to a boil.
6. Reduce the heat to low, cover the saucepan, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the vegetables are tender.
7. Stir in the tofu, sweet potato, and kale. Cook for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the vegetables are cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
8. Season with salt and lime juice to taste.
9. Serve the Vegetarian Panang Curry over rice or noodles, and garnish with roasted cashews.

The essential ingredients for this Vegetarian Panang Curry include canola oil, shallot, ginger, garlic, peanut butter, turmeric, cumin, red curry paste, water, coconut milk, lime zest, brown sugar or maple syrup, sea salt, tofu, sweet potato, kale, lime juice, and roasted cashews. These ingredients will create a delicious and flavorful vegetarian curry that is both satisfying and healthy.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. On a floured work surface, roll out crescent rolls into one large rectangle, pinching together seams.
In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil.
Cook chicken until cooked through and golden, 4 to 6 minutes per side.
Transfer to a cutting board and thinly slice.
In a small bowl, stir together Dijon and honey.
Spread honey mustard all over Crescent rectangle and layer with ham, chicken, and gruyere.
Starting from the bottom, tightly roll up the rectangle like a cinnamon roll, then slice into four rolls.
Transfer to a glass baking dish and bake until puffed and golden, 15 to 20 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the dijon mustard and honey until well combined.
3. Season the chicken breast with salt and pepper.
4. In a large skillet, heat the extra-virgin olive oil over medium heat. Add the chicken breast and cook until browned on both sides and cooked through, about 4-5 minutes per side.
5. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
6. In the same skillet, add the dijon mustard and honey mixture. Cook until the sauce has thickened slightly, about 1-2 minutes.
7. Add the sliced deli ham to the skillet and cook until heated through.
8. Roll out the crescent rolls on a floured surface to form a rectangle.
9. Spread the cooked chicken mixture evenly over the crescent rolls.
10. Roll the crescent rolls up, starting from the long side, and place them seam-side down on a baking sheet.
11. Bake the roll-ups in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown.
12. Remove the roll-ups from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
1.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. 2.
Combine flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
3.
In a separate mixing bowl, beat softened butter and both sugars until mixture turns smooth and creamy.
4.
Add eggs one at a time, mixing well between each and scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed.
5.
Add amaretto and almond extract.
6.
Mix in chocolate chips, coconut flakes, and almonds.
7.
Scoop dough onto cookie sheets.
It helps to use an ice cream scoop to ensure all cookies are the same size.
8.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes.
9.
Remove from oven and let cool slightly before removing from the pan.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Almond Joy Cookies dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and brown sugar until smooth.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. Stir in the Amaretto and almond extract until well combined.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until a smooth dough forms.
7. Fold in the chocolate chips, white chocolate chips, coconut flakes, and sliced almonds.
8. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a greased baking sheet.
9. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden.
10. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Almond Joy Cookies!

gt:
Mix tomatoes, corn, and sweet onion in a bowl.
Sprinkle lime juice over tomato mixture.
Pour olive oil over tomato mixture.
Fold watermelon into tomato mixture.
Season with salt to serve.
Let sit 5 minutes before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Cut the corn off the cob and remove the kernels.
3. In a large bowl, combine the corn, tomatoes, onion, and lime juice.
4. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
5. In a small bowl, mix the olive oil, watermelon, and a pinch of salt.
6. Add the watermelon mixture to the corn mixture and toss to combine.
7. Serve the dish immediately or refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Whisk oil, 2 tablespoons vinegar, and 1 garlic clove in small bowl for marinade.
Using spoon, scrape out gills from mushrooms and place mushrooms on rimmed baking sheet.
Brush marinade over both sides of mushrooms, arrange hollow side up, and let stand at room temperature 30 minutes.
Prepare barbecue (medium heat).
Mix panko, next 5 ingredients, and remaining 2 garlic cloves in medium bowl.
Drizzle butter and remaining teaspoon vinegar over panko mixture and toss.
Divide panko mixture among mushrooms, leaving 1/2-inch border around edges and packing down slightly.
Place mushrooms on grill, stuffing side up; cover grill and cook until cheese melts and juices bubble at edges of mushrooms, rearranging mushrooms occasionally for even cooking (do not turn over), about 6 minutes.
*Panko can be used in any recipe calling for dry (not fresh) breadcrumbs such as eggplant parmigiana, chicken tenders, or meatloaf.
It is available in the Asian foods section of some supermarkets and at Asian markets.
pred:
1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. In a large bowl, mix together the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, minced garlic, and oregano. Season the portobello mushrooms with salt and pepper, then toss them in the marinade.
3. Place the mushrooms on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
4. Grill the mushrooms for about 5-7 minutes per side, or until they are tender and slightly charred.
5. While the mushrooms are grilling, prepare the panko mixture by combining the panko, mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, green onions, and thyme in a small bowl.
6. Once the mushrooms are cooked, remove them from the grill and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. Carefully slice the mushrooms in half and stuff each half with the panko mixture.
8. Heat the melted butter in a small saucepan over medium heat.
9. Place the stuffed mushrooms on the grill or grill pan and cook for about 2-3 minutes per side, or until the panko is golden brown and the mushrooms are heated through.
10. Serve the Mozzarella-Stuffed Grilled Portobellos with Balsamic Marinade immediately.

[/INST]

This delicious dish is made by marinating portobello mushrooms with a mixture of olive oil, balsamic vinegar, garlic, oregano, and thyme, then grilling them until tender and slightly charred. The mushrooms are then stuffed with a panko and cheese mixture, and cooked in a small saucepan with melted butter. The final step is to serve the stuffed mushrooms on the grill or grill pan, allowing the panko to become golden brown and the mushrooms to be heated through. This dish is a delightful combination of flavors and textures, making it a perfect choice for a delicious and satisfying meal.

gt:
Wash the meat and cut it into pieces you desire.
Put the meat, salt, vinegar, crushed garlic and peppercorn together and allow it to cook for 30 minutes.
In your skillet, on medium heat, put cooking oil and crushed garlic.
When garlic is brown, add chopped onions and tomatoes.
When tomatoes are done, add the pork adobo with juices and cook it for another 30 minutes on simmer.
Serve with steamed rice.
pred:
1. Cut the pork into bite-sized pieces.
2. In a large pot, combine the pork, vinegar, salt, and water. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 1 1/2 hours, or until the pork is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
3. Remove the pork from the pot and set aside.
4. In a large skillet, heat the cooking oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and onion, and cook until the onion is translucent.
5. Add the tomatoes, peppercorn, and cook for about 5 minutes or until the tomatoes are softened.
6. Return the pork to the pot, and stir to combine the ingredients. Cook for an additional 10 minutes, or until the pork is heated through and the sauce has thickened.
7. Serve the Pork Adobo over rice or with your preferred side dish.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Cut the tofu horizontally into three equal slabs.
Wrap each slab in a clean tea towel or paper towel and press the toful for 45 minutes.
If time does not permit, wrap tofu and press gently to extract as much moisture as possible.
For seasoning mix; place the nutritional yeast, salt, herbs, and spices in a wide, shallow mixing bowl.
Stir well to combine.
Stir the milk and lemon juice together in a small mixing bowl.
Place the flour in mixing bowl.
Cut each slab of tofu into 4 triangles, making a total of 12 in all.
Working with one piece at a time, dredge the tofu in the flour.
Shake off any excess.
Now submerge the tofu in the "soured" milk.
Coat the tofu in the seasoning mix.
Coat a large skillet with vegetable oil and heat over medium high heat.
When oil is hot, add the tofu pieces in a single layer.
Cook until bottoms are well browned, then turn pieces over and cook until browned.
Add more oil between batches and adjust the heat as necessary.
As soon as tofu is removed from the skillet, place it on a plate lined with paper towels and blot off excess oil.
Serve and enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the tofu, nutritional yeast flakes, salt, garlic granules, onion powder, parsley flakes, paprika, tarragon, dill weed, basil leaves, oregano leaves, curry powder, dry mustard, rosemary, and celery seed.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, lemon juice, and flour until smooth.
4. Pour the milk mixture into the tofu mixture and stir until well combined.
5. Heat a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat. Add the vegetable oil and swirl to coat the pan.
6. Pour the tofu mixture into the pan and cook for about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the tofu is golden brown and the mixture is heated through.
7. Transfer the cooked tofu mixture to a baking dish, and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the tofu is cooked through and the mixture is hot and bubbly.
8. Serve the savory Southern Fried Tofu dish immediately, garnished with fresh parsley or chopped green onions, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious and satisfying Southern Fried Tofu dish!

gt:
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Stir to mix well.
Pour into a large slow cooker, cover and cook on low heat for 2 hours.
Make sure to stir it every 30 minutes.
Check often to make sure its not cooking too quickly as every slow cooker is a bit different.
Remove pretzels from the slow cooker and transfer to parchment lined cookie sheets to allow them to cool and dry.
Takes about an hour for them to dry.
Serve with a big old taco lovin, pretzel lovin smile!
Notes: You can totally tone down the spice by only using 1/4 to 1/2 of the taco seasoning.
I just like spicy.
If you find it not mixing well you can add more oil.
Make sure you adjust your time up or down depending on the size of your crockpot.
Mine is huge so 2 hours worked.
You could leave the lid off to help keep it from burning or cooking too fast.
I just didnt want to heat up my house.
Normally I leave the lid off when making party mix in there.
* Recipe adapted from Bake Your Day, cooking method changed.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the Rold Gold Tiny Twist Pretzels, Taco Seasoning, and Canola Oil. Mix well to ensure even distribution of the seasoning.
3. Spread the seasoned pretzels out on a baking sheet or a lined baking sheet.
4. Bake the pretzels in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy.
5. Remove the pretzels from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Slow Cooker Taco Seasoned Pretzels!

gt:
Flatten the chicken breasts between 2 pieces of parchment paper.
Sprinkle them with lemon juice and then with salt and pepper.
Heat the butter in your frying pan and brown the chicken breasts then use a medium heat to cook them for about ten minutes, they should be almost done.
Then you add the Metaxa bit by bit and let it gently evaporate.
After that add the cream, let it heat through and thicken a bit.
If using the herbs, add, mix and serve.
pred:
To cook a delicious Chicken in a Metaxa Cream Sauce dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
3. In a small bowl, mix the lemon juice, butter, and chopped herbs (basil, tarragon, or parsley).
4. Place the chicken breasts in a baking dish, and pour the lemon-butter mixture over them.
5. Bake the chicken in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes or until it is cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
6. While the chicken is cooking, prepare the Metaxa Cream Sauce. In a saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat.
7. Add the cream, and stir until it is fully incorporated.
8. Reduce the heat to low, and simmer the sauce for about 5-7 minutes or until it thickens slightly.
9. Remove the chicken from the oven, and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into thin pieces.
10. Pour the Metaxa Cream Sauce over the chicken, and serve immediately.

This delicious Chicken in a Metaxa Cream Sauce dish is a perfect combination of flavors, with the tangy lemon juice, rich buttery sauce, and the tender, juicy chicken. The herbs (basil, tarragon, or parsley) add an extra layer of flavor and aroma, making the dish even more delightful.

gt: Combine all and use on any meat to add flavor and spice!
pred:
To make a delicious Mike's Special Seasoning dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine all the seasoning ingredients: 2 teaspoons paprika, 12 teaspoons ground black pepper, 14 teaspoons salt, 12 teaspoon dark brown sugar, 14 teaspoon garlic powder, 14 teaspoon onion powder, and 14 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper.
3. Mix the ingredients thoroughly to ensure even distribution of the seasonings.
4. Spread the seasoning mixture evenly over the surface of a large baking sheet or roasting pan.
5. Place the baking sheet or roasting pan in the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the seasoning mixture is fragrant and slightly crispy.
6. Remove the baking sheet or roasting pan from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Transfer the seasoning mixture to a small bowl or airtight container, and store it in a cool, dry place.

Once the seasoning mixture has cooled, you can use it to season various dishes, such as meats, vegetables, or grains, to create delicious, flavorful meals.

gt:
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, cream of tartar, baking soda and salt.
In a large bowl, using an electric mixer, beat sugar,butter and shortening on high speed for two minutes until creamed.
Add egg and vanilla, beat until fully incorporated.
Add flour mixture to egg/sugar mixture and blend on low until just combined.
Refrigerate dough for 30-40 minutes.
Preheat oven to 375
Combine sugar/cinnamon in a shallow bowl for dough coating.
Shape dough into 1" balls, roll dough balls in sugar/cinnamon until completely covered.
Arrange dough balls 2" apart on parchment lined cookie sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until centers of cookies are set and cracks form in the cookie.
pred:
To cook a delicious EZ Snickerdoodles dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the flour, cream of tartar, baking soda, and salt.
3. Add the softened butter and vegetable shortening to the flour mixture, and mix until the ingredients are well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg, vanilla extract, and cinnamon.
5. Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry mixture, stirring until the dough comes together.
6. Roll the dough into small balls, and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
8. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious EZ Snickerdoodles dish!

gt:
In a skillet over medium heat, saute garlic, onion, and carrots in oil until tender.
Transfer to greased 2-quart baking dish; add broth, barley, sage, salt, and pepper.
Mix well.
Cover and bake at 350 for 1 hour.
Stir in corn and parsley, cover and bake 10 to 15 minutes more or until barley is tender and corn is heated through.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the minced garlic, chopped onion, and cooking oil. Mix well.
3. Add the chicken broth, pearl barley, sage, salt, and pepper. Stir to combine.
4. Add the thawed frozen corn and chopped fresh parsley. Stir to combine.
5. Transfer the mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
6. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until the barley is tender and the corn is cooked through.
7. Remove the casserole from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

[/INST]

This Barley Corn Casserole is a delicious and nutritious meal that combines the flavors of corn, barley, and sage. The addition of garlic and onion provides a rich and savory base, while the chicken broth adds moisture and depth to the dish. The frozen corn adds a touch of freshness and sweetness, and the chopped parsley adds a burst of color and aroma. This casserole is perfect for a cozy evening meal or a hearty side dish to accompany a main course.

gt:
1.
Preheat grill to high.2.
Coat bread slices with cooking spray.
Place the bread on grill rack coated with cooking spray; grill for 1 minute or until golden, turning once.
Remove bread from grill.
Cut 1 garlic clove in half; rub both sides of bread with cut sides of garlic clove.
Discard clove.3.
Pat anchovy fillets dry with a paper towel.
Combine remaining 2 garlic cloves, 2 anchovy fillets, juice, mustard, pepper, salt, and egg yolk in a blender; process until smooth.
With blender on, add oil, 1 tablespoon at a time; process until smooth.4.
Place lettuce, cut sides down, on a grill rack coated with cooking spray; grill 2 minutes.
Turn; grill 1 minute.
Remove from heat; coarsely chop lettuce.
Place lettuce in a large bowl; drizzle with dressing, tossing gently to coat.5.
Cut remaining 5 anchovy fillets in half lengthwise.
Arrange about 3/4 cup salad on each of 10 plates; top each serving with 1 bread slice and 1 anchovy half.
Sprinkle each serving with about 1 1/2 teaspoons Parmigiano-Reggiano.
pred:
1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. In a small bowl, mix the egg yolk, lemon juice, mustard, and pepper. Set aside.
3. In a large bowl, toss the romaine lettuce with the cooking spray.
4. Spread the cooking spray on the grill or grill pan.
5. Place the bread slices on the grill or grill pan, cut side down, and cook until they are golden brown and crispy, about 2-3 minutes. Flip the bread slices and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy on both sides.
6. Remove the bread from the grill or grill pan and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Place the grilled bread on a serving platter.
8. In a large bowl, toss the romaine lettuce with the dressing made from the egg yolk mixture.
9. Spread the dressing over the grilled bread.
10. Sprinkle the shaved Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese over the salad.
11. Serve immediately and enjoy your Grilled Caesar Salad dish.

gt:
If you made the stuffed zucchini recipe I submitted, this is a great way to use up the scooped out insides.
Take your grated vegetables and place in a bowl.
Crack the egg(s) and mix with a wooden spoon.
Add the feta cheese.
Mix.
Then, add the flour, but rather than just dumping the flour in, put in half and add as you mix.
The consistency should resemble that of thick pancake batter, so 1 cup of flour may be too much or not enough.
It depends on your vegetables, eggs, etc.
You can play it by ear with this one.
Let it rest for a few minutes as your oil warms up.
Ladle or spoon out silver dollar-sized portions, adding batter to the oil and pushing slightly on the fritter.
Turn once as soon as the bottom side becomes golden.
Try to keep the heat on medium so that the inside will cook as well as the outside.
Place on a kitchen towel to drain excess oil.
Again, serve alone or with plain yoghurt!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the grated zucchini, carrot, and potatoes.
3. Add the grated egg, crumbled feta cheese, and flour. Mix well to combine.
4. Heat oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat.
5. Using a spoon or your hands, form the mixture into small, round balls.
6. Carefully place the balls in the hot oil and fry for about 5-7 minutes, or until golden brown.
7. Remove the fritters from the oil and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
8. Serve the Mucver Fritters warm, as a side dish or appetizer.

[/INST]

gt:
For the cookies: Place rack in center of the oven and preheat oven to 375 F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper or a Silpat mat and set aside.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, espresso powder, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and salt.
Set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, beat together the butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar.
Add the pumpkin, egg, and vanilla extract and mix until well combined.
Add the dry ingredients, then mix on low speed until incorporated.
Drop dough by large, rounded tablespoons onto the prepared baking sheet (leave a couple inches between each) and flatten slightly with your fingers.
Bake for 9 to 11 minutes, until the cookies are lightly browned at the edges and dry to the touch.
Remove pan from oven.
Let them cool on the baking sheet for 3 minutes, then transfer to a wire cooling rack to cool completely.
For the frosting: Beat together the powdered sugar, cream cheese, and butter on medium low.
Beat in the cinnamon and vanilla extract.
Spread over cooled cookies and serve.
pred:
To make a delicious Pumpkin Spice Latte Cookies with Cinnamon Cream Cheese Frosting dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the egg, one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the dry ingredients: flours, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, alternating with the pumpkin puree, and mix until just combined.
6. Fold in the light cream cheese and vanilla extract.
7. Chill the dough in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
8. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Scoop the dough into balls, about 2 tablespoons each, and place them on the prepared baking sheet.
10. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are set and slightly golden around the edges.
11. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

To make the Cinnamon Cream Cheese Frosting, beat the butter and powdered sugar in a small bowl until smooth and creamy. Add the cinnamon and vanilla extract, and mix until well combined.

Assemble the cookies by placing a small amount of frosting on the top of each cookie, and spreading it evenly to create a smooth, even layer.

Enjoy your delicious Pumpkin Spice Latte Cookies with Cinnamon Cream Cheese Frosting!

gt:
Add contents in a bowl
Lightly mash till consistency of a crumble if too wrt add flour and sugar by teaspoon
After spread out flour on the counter and a rolling pin and tool doe like you were making biscuits the cut the cookies about a 1-1.5" and let bake at 3:50 for 10-15 minutes
After they are JUST taken out add 1 cranberry on top of each one and let cool for five minutes
Serve with milk
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and baking soda.
3. Add the cold butter cubes to the dry ingredients and mix until the butter is evenly distributed.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg, milk, and vanilla extract.
5. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry mixture and mix until the dough comes together.
6. If the dough is too dry, you can add a bit more milk, one tablespoon at a time, until it reaches the desired consistency.
7. On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough out to your desired thickness.
8. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a knife.
9. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
11. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
12. Once the cookies have cooled, you can decorate them with dried cranberries, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Butter Sugar Cookies!

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Dissolve the baking soda in the water.
Combine the oats, flour and brown sugar.
Cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in the baking soda mixture and form dough into a ball.
Either roll dough out to 1/4 inch thick and cut with cookie cutters or press dough into the bottom of one 9x13 inch baking pan.
Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 12 to 15 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the oats, flour, baking soda, and water, and mix until well combined.
4. Roll the dough into small balls, and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
5. Bake the cookies for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
6. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Margie's Shortbread Oatmeal Cookies!

gt:
In large mixer bowl, beat margarine and sugar until creamy.
Add vanilla; then gradually beat in flour, blending thoroughly.
Gather dough into a ball, wrap tightly in plastic wrap, and refrigerate until firm (1 hour) or for up to 3 days.
Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
On lightly floured board, roll out dough to 1/4" thick.
Cut, place on lightly greased sheets.
Bake 35-40 minutes or until firm to the touch (press very lightly to test).
Transfer to racks and let cool.
Store in an airtight container.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the vanilla extract and mix well.
4. Gradually add the flour, mixing until a dough forms.
5. Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead until smooth and pliable.
6. Roll the dough out to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
7. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
8. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake the cookies for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
10. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Brown Sugar Shortbread Cookies!

gt:
Double sift together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
Have the buttermilk at room temperature.
Add the oil and the egg to the sifted mixture.
Add 1/2 cup of buttermilk and stir.
To the other 1/2 cup stir in the baking soda.
Fold together and prepare to smile as these come off the griddle.
pred:
To prepare Violet Murphy's Southern Hotcakes, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, salt, and baking soda.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg and oil together.
3. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until just combined.
4. Gradually add the buttermilk, stirring until the batter reaches the desired consistency.
5. Preheat a skillet or griddle over medium heat.
6. Grease the skillet or griddle with a small amount of oil.
7. Pour the batter onto the skillet or griddle, using a ladle or a spoon.
8. Cook the hotcakes until they are golden brown on both sides and the edges are slightly crispy.
9. Serve the hotcakes with your favorite toppings, such as butter, syrup, or fruit.

The essential ingredients for Violet Murphy's Southern Hotcakes include 1 cup flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 12 teaspoon salt, 1 egg, 1 tablespoon oil, 1 cup buttermilk, and 12 teaspoon baking soda. These ingredients will provide the necessary components for a delicious and satisfying Southern Hotcake experience.

gt:
Spread 1/2 tablespoon butter on one side of each piece of toasted Italian bread.
Set aside.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over high heat.
When oil begins to smoke, pour scallops into pan.
Cook for 30 seconds without stirring.
Toss scallops in pan and stir in garlic.
Cook and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Stir wine and lemon juice into scallops, bring to a boil, and cook for about 30 seconds.
Stir parsley and cold butter into scallops and remove from heat.
When butter melts, stir in salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper.
Spoon scallops over buttered toast and serve immediately.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the melted butter, olive oil, minced garlic, lemon juice, and cayenne pepper. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Spread the mixture evenly over the toasted Italian bread slices.
4. Place the bread slices on a baking sheet and bake for 5-7 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the butter mixture is melted and bubbly.
5. Remove the bread from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. In a large skillet, heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat. Add the bay scallops and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until they are cooked through and opaque.
7. Add the white wine to the skillet and cook until it has reduced by half.
8. Add the minced garlic, lemon juice, and chopped parsley to the skillet. Cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until the sauce is heated through and slightly thickened.
9. Place the cooked scallops on top of the toasted bread slices.
10. Drizzle the melted butter mixture over the scallops and bread.
11. Serve immediately and enjoy your delicious Bay Scallops with Garlic Parsley Butter Sauce dish.

gt:
Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Spray a 9x13-inch baking pan with cooking spray.
Combine flour, sugar, vegetable oil, eggs, salt, baking soda, vanilla extract, and cinnamon in a large bowl; mix well.
Stir in the chopped apples until just combined.
Pour batter into the prepared baking pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 1 hour.
pred:
[/INST]

To make Adam's Apple Cake, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooking spray, flour, sugar, vegetable oil, eggs, salt, baking soda, vanilla extract, and ground cinnamon. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the chopped apples to the mixture and stir to combine.
4. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
5. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for about 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
6. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Adam's Apple Cake!

gt:
In a medium skillet add olive oil, heat over medium heat and add onions.
Cook until slightly soft about 4 minutes, add garlic and cook for another 2 minutes.
Drain and rinse all your beans.
Add onion and garlic mix to your crockpot along with with tomatoes, cilantro, cumin, chili, salt, pepper, beans and 1 cup of water.
Cover and cook on low for about 4 hours.
If needed add the extra cup of water if dip is too dry.
Serve garnished with cilantro, cheese, avocado and sour cream.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the beans, onion, garlic, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
3. Add the water, and mix until well combined.
4. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish, and bake for about 30-40 minutes, or until the beans are tender and the dip is heated through.
5. While the dip is baking, prepare the garnishes.
6. Remove the dip from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Stir in the shredded cheddar cheese and chopped cilantro.
8. Serve the bean dip with the diced avocado and sour cream on the side, as desired.

Enjoy your homemade Bean Dip with the fresh garnishes, and feel free to customize the recipe to your liking.

gt:
Combine chicken, sour cream, soup and salsa in a bowl.
Divide chicken mixture and cheese evenly among 4 tortillas.
Cover with remaining tortillas.
Heat one tortilla stack in a large skillet sprayed with cooking spray over medium heat for 2-3 minutes.
Turn tortilla over and repeat for another 2-3 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Repeat with the remaining tortilla stacks.
Cut each one into 4 wedges and serve with additional salsa and sour cream.

gt:
Mix cream cheese and dressing until blended.
Spread onto bottom of shallow serving dish.
Top with remaining ingredients.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the softened cream cheese, Miracle Whip dressing, and pesto sauce until well combined.
3. Add the chopped artichoke hearts, roasted red peppers, and KRAFT finely shredded Italian five cheese blend to the bowl. Mix until well combined.
4. Transfer the mixture to a serving dish or individual ramekins.
5. Bake the dip in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the dip is hot and bubbly.
6. Serve the Mediterranean Dip immediately, and enjoy with pita chips or crackers.

The essential ingredients for the 10-Minute Mediterranean Dip for a Crowd are:
1 pkg. (8 oz.) PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese, softened
1/2 cup MIRACLE WHIP Dressing Family Dollar $3.50 thru 02/07
1/4 cup CLASSICO Traditional Basil Pesto Sauce and Spread
1/4 cup chopped drained canned artichoke hearts
1 cup chopped roasted red peppers
1 cup KRAFT Finely Shredded Italian Five Cheese Blend.

gt:
Preheat oven to 425.
Combine olives, cheese, salsa (or picante sauce), cilantro, green onions, and (optional) cooked chicken, mix well.
Place 4 tortillas on a baking sheet (or large round stone) Divide the cheese mixture evenly among tortillas and spread.
Top each tortilla with second tortilla pressing down firmly, spray tops with cooking spray.
Bake 8-10 minutes or until tops are lightly browned.
Remove from oven and cool for 5 minutes.
Cut each quesadilla into 6 wedges.
Serve with additional salsa (or picante) or sour cream if desired.
pred:
To make delicious Quesadillas, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the chopped olive, monterey jack cheese, and salsa or picante sauce.
3. Spray a large skillet or griddle with cooking spray.
4. Place the tortillas on the skillet or griddle, and cook them for about 1 minute on each side, until they are slightly browned and pliable.
5. Add the cheese and salsa mixture to one half of each tortilla, leaving the other half plain.
6. Carefully fold the tortillas in half, enclosing the filling.
7. Place the filled tortillas back on the skillet or griddle, and cook for about 4 minutes on each side, or until the cheese is melted and the tortillas are golden brown.
8. Serve the Quesadillas immediately, and enjoy with sour cream and salsa or picante sauce on the side, if desired.

This delicious Quesadillas dish is a popular choice for a satisfying and flavorful meal, with a variety of ingredients that can be customized to suit individual preferences.

gt:
Trim fat from lamb.
Place lamb in an electric slow cooker, and sprinkle with oregano, rind, and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Pour in juice; top lamb with spinach.
Cover with lid; cook on high heat for 1 hour.
Reduce heat setting to low; cook 7 hours.
Remove spinach and lamb from slow cooker, reserving cooking liquid; cool.
Remove meat from bones; discard bones, fat, and gristle.
Chop meat.Place a zip-top plastic bag inside a 2-cup glass measure.
Pour drippings into bag, and let stand 10 minutes (fat will rise to the top).
Seal bag; carefully snip off 1 bottom corner of bag.
Drain drippings into a large bowl, stopping before fat layer reaches opening; discard fat.Add 1/4 teaspoon salt, lamb, spinach, orzo, and feta to strained drippings.
Garnish with oregano sprigs and lemon slices, if desired.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Season the lamb shoulder with 1/4 cup of chopped fresh or 4 teaspoons of dried oregano, 1 tablespoon of grated lemon rind, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt.
3. In a large bowl, combine the lamb, lemon juice, and 1/4 cup of fresh lemon juice. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
4. In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the onions and cook until they are soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
5. Add the garlic and cook for another 2 minutes, until fragrant.
6. Add the spinach and cook until it has wilted, about 2 minutes.
7. Add the cooked orzo to the skillet and stir to combine.
8. Add the cooked lamb and any juices that have accumulated in the bowl. Stir to combine.
9. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Transfer the mixture to a large baking dish and top with crumbled feta cheese.
11. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 1 hour, or until the lamb is cooked through and the feta cheese is melted and bubbly.
12. Serve the Aegean Lamb with Orzo hot, garnished with a sprig of oregano and a lemon slice if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat grill, setting all burners on low to medium-low (about 400F).
Remove wrapper and cardboard from frozen pizza.
Place pizza directly on center of grill rack; close lid.
Grill 13 min., rotating pizza 1/2 turn with spatula after 8 min.
Continue grilling, covered, for specified time or until cheese is melted and crust is golden brown.
Let stand 2 to 3 min.
before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat the grill to a medium heat setting.
2. Remove the pizza from the package and place it on a pizza stone or a well-oiled baking sheet.
3. Spread a thin layer of tomato sauce over the pizza crust.
4. Add your desired toppings, such as pepperoni, mushrooms, onions, and bell peppers.
5. Place the pizza on the grill, ensuring that the grill grates are not too close to the pizza.
6. Cook the pizza for approximately 10-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Remove the pizza from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes before cutting it into slices and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Finely chop all of the ingredients.
Mix all of the ingredients together, add the ingredients from Step 1, and it is done.
Try with sashimi...
With cold shabu shabu...
Coat meat and vegetables in katakuriko and fry until crisp.
You could also use this to make boiled pork.
I made this with doubanjiang and oyster sauce.
Here is the.
pred:
1. Wash and chop the Japanese leek into small pieces.
2. Peel and chop the garlic (optional).
3. Chop the ginger into small pieces.
4. Rinse and drain the Cashew nuts.
5. In a small bowl, mix the soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and sesame oil.
6. Add the chopped Japanese leek, garlic (if using), ginger, and Cashew nuts to the bowl.
7. Stir the ingredients together until well combined.
8. Taste the dressing and adjust the seasoning as needed.
9. Serve the All-Purpose Dressing with Nuts over your favorite salad or as a dip for vegetables.

[/INST]

gt:
1.
Heat the olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat.
When the oil is warm, add the onions.
Cook, stirring frequently, until the onions are softened.
Remove from heat.
2.
In a bowl combine the ground turkey, sweet chili sauce, chopped basil and softened onions.
Form into 6 even-sized patties.
Set on a plate while you heat your grill to medium-high heat.
3.
Put patties onto the hot grill.
Grill the burgers for about 5-8 minutes on each side or until the internal temperature is 165 degrees F. Remove from grill to a clean plate.
4.
Serve on hamburger buns, either plain or with additional sweet chili sauce and basil leaves.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet or frying pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the ground turkey (or other ground meat of choice) to the skillet and cook until browned, breaking up any large chunks with a spoon. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. In a small bowl, mix the Thai Sweet Chili Sauce and chopped Thai Basil (or other basil variety) until well combined.
5. Add the cooked turkey mixture to the skillet and stir in the Thai Sweet Chili Sauce mixture. Cook until the sauce is fully incorporated and the turkey is cooked through.
6. Transfer the turkey mixture to a large mixing bowl and let it cool slightly.
7. Once the turkey mixture is cool enough to handle, shape it into four equal-sized patties.
8. Place the patties on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake the patties in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
10. While the patties are baking, prepare the hamburger buns by spreading mayonnaise on the cut sides of each bun.
11. Once the patties are cooked, remove them from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes.
12. Assemble the burgers by placing a cooked patty on each bun, topped with the cut side of the bun.
13. Serve the Sweet Thai Turkey Burgers immediately, and enjoy!

gt:
Just briefly mix the above ingredients together.
Then, dip your favorite foods into it, fry it up, and enjoy!
I served the tempura over chilled udon noodles.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, katakuriko, mayonnaise, vinegar, and salt.
2. Gradually add the cold water, stirring constantly to form a smooth batter.
3. Cover the bowl and let the batter rest for about 30 minutes.
4. After the batter has rested, stir it again to ensure that the ingredients are well-combined.
5. Preheat oil in a deep fryer or a large pot to a temperature of 350°F (175°C).
6. Using a spoon, scoop out a small amount of batter and drop it into the hot oil.
7. Carefully fry the battered food until it is golden brown and cooked through.
8. Remove the fried food from the oil and drain on paper towels.
9. Repeat the process with the remaining batter and fried food.

By following these key steps, you can prepare a perfect The Secret to Making Tempura Batter and enjoy delicious tempura dishes.

gt:
Combine all ingredients in food processor and blend until smooth.
Transfer to a bowl; cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.
Serve with pita bread, pretzels or vegetables.
Makes about 1 1/2 cups.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese, feta cheese, sour cream, and black olives.
3. Add minced garlic, dried oregano, dried parsley, salt, and hot pepper sauce. Mix well.
4. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the dip is hot and bubbly.
5. Serve the Great Greek Dip with pita chips, crackers, or vegetables for dipping.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat canola oil on med-hi heat in a large skillet.
Saute the onions, garlic, and jalapeno for 1 minute.
Add the turkey and cook until it is no longer pink (about 5 minutes).
Turn down heat to med-low and add the peas and the water chestnuts.
Cook for about 5 more minutes.
Add lime zest, lime juice, soy sauce, and pepper flakes; Stir then remove from heat.
Pour turkey mix into a bowl so you can use the skillet.
Put a tortilla into the skillet; put some turkey mix on it then add cheese and peanuts to your taste.
Fold the tortilla over and cook over med.
heat until browned on both sides (using a spatula to turn and flatten).
Add more oil as you need to brown each quesadilla.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the canola oil over medium-high heat. Add the ground turkey and cook until it is browned and fully cooked through, breaking it up into small pieces as it cooks.
3. Add the sweet peas, water chestnuts, green onions, and garlic to the skillet. Cook for a few minutes until the vegetables are tender.
4. Add the jalapeno, lime juice, and zest, and stir to combine. Cook for another minute or two, until the flavors are well-mixed.
5. Remove the skillet from the heat and let it cool slightly.
6. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked turkey mixture, cheddar cheese, and crushed dry roasted peanuts.
7. Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium-high heat. Place the tortillas on the skillet or griddle, one at a time, and cook for about 30 seconds on each side, until they are slightly browned and crispy.
8. Place a spoonful of the turkey mixture on one side of each tortilla, leaving a small border around the edges.
9. Fold the tortilla over the filling, creating a half-moon shape. Cook for a few minutes on each side, until the cheese is melted and the tortilla is crispy on the outside.
10. Serve the Kung Pao Quesadillas immediately, and enjoy!

gt:
Pour water in pan to 3/4 in and bring to simmer.
Add chicken , cover and poach over med/low heat for about 12 -15 minutes.
Put on a plate and refrigerate till cool enough to handle.
Then finely dice.
In a bowl stir all remaining ingredients including the chicken.
Butter the bread with the softened butter and spread 1 slice with the mixture.
Top with remaining slice of bread.
Trim the crust and cut the sandwich into triangles or squares for little hands.
If you want to make ahead , place on a baking sheet and cover with a damp cloth and cover tightly with plastic wrap for up to 24 hours.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Season the chicken breast with salt and pepper.
3. Place the chicken breast on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes or until cooked through.
4. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
5. Once the chicken is cool enough to handle, remove the skin and shred the meat into bite-sized pieces.
6. In a large bowl, combine the shredded chicken, finely diced peeled apple, green onion, and mayonnaise.
7. Mix well to ensure the chicken is evenly coated with the dressing.
8. If desired, add a pinch of curry powder to the mixture for extra flavor.
9. Season the salad with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Spread the salad mixture onto the slices of bread.
11. Place the bread slices on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 5-7 minutes or until the bread is golden brown and the filling is melted and warm.
12. Remove the sandwiches from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Crunchy Chicken Apple Salad Sandwiches!

gt:
In a large bowl, mix the water with 2 tablespoons of the vinegar.
Swirl the bread cubes in the vinegar water, then drain the bread in a colander, gently squeezing out any excess moisture.
In a small bowl, mix the olive oil with the remaining 1 tablespoon of vinegar.
In a large bowl, stir the cherry tomatoes with the celery, olives, onion, basil, mint and oregano.
Gently fold in the bread.
Add the dressing and toss well.
Season with salt and pepper and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the cubed bread, red wine vinegar, and olive oil. Toss to coat the bread evenly.
3. Spread the bread mixture on a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and crispy.
4. In a large bowl, combine the cherry tomatoes, celery, green olives, onion, basil, mint, oregano, and salt.
5. In a small bowl, whisk together the red wine vinegar, olive oil, and pepper.
6. Pour the dressing over the salad mixture and toss to combine.
7. Serve the Bread Salad with Tomatoes and Olives immediately, or refrigerate for up to 24 hours before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place chicken in an ovenproof baking dish, and place in preheated oven, and bake for 25 minutes.
Meanwhile, combine milk, canned chipotles, garlic, cumin, onion powder, and salt in a blender or food processor and puree until smooth.
Heat butter and flour in a large skillet and blend until smooth; add heavy cream and sour cream, whisking until smooth.
Stir in chipotle puree, and stir constantly until mixture comes to a boil and thickens; remove from heat.
After chicken has baked 25 minutes, remove from oven and drain any fat.
Pour chipotle cream over chicken and top with grated queso cheese.
Replace chicken in oven and bake for about 20 minutes more, or until cheese just starts to brown.
Remove from oven and serve with extra sauce spooned over chicken and garnished with minced chipotle chiles, if desired.
Goes good with steamed rice (and extra sauce on top).
pred:
[INST]To make a delicious Southwest Chicken with Chipotle Cream dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chicken legs, milk, and spices (ground cumin, onion powder, salt, and pepper). Mix well to ensure the chicken is evenly coated.
3. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
4. In a large skillet, heat the butter or margarine over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook until it is fully cooked through, about 10-15 minutes.
5. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
6. In the same skillet, add the flour and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly. Gradually add the heavy cream and sour cream, stirring until smooth.
7. Add the cooked chicken back to the skillet, and stir to combine.
8. Add the grated queso cheese and minced chipotle chile. Stir until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth.
9. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened.
10. Serve the Southwest Chicken with Chipotle Cream dish hot, garnished with minced chipotle chile if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Boil your choice of pasta according to the packet instructions
Chop the plumb tomatoes in half
Tear or chop the ham into bite sized pieces
Once the pasta is ready, drain and return to the pan
Add the pesto to the pasta and stir in
Add the tomatoes, shredded ham, and a few leaves of rocket
Serve!
pred:
To prepare a delicious Ham and pesto pasta dish, follow these steps:
1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions, usually by boiling it in salted water until it reaches the desired doneness.
2. While the pasta is cooking, prepare the pesto sauce by blending the following ingredients: 3 tsp Green pesto, 1/2 cup olive oil, 1 clove of garlic, 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
3. Once the pasta is cooked, drain it and return it to the pot.
4. Add the cooked Ham slices to the pot, and stir to combine.
5. Pour the pesto sauce over the pasta and Ham mixture, and stir to coat everything evenly.
6. Add the chopped rocket and sliced tomatoes to the pot, and stir to combine.
7. Season the dish with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Serve the Ham and pesto pasta dish immediately, and enjoy the delicious combination of flavors and textures.

This dish is a great option for a quick and satisfying meal, as it combines the rich flavors of the pesto sauce, the tender texture of the pasta, and the savory taste of the Ham. The addition of the rocket and tomatoes adds a fresh, crunchy element to the dish, making it even more enjoyable.

gt:
In a bowl, stir together the cheese and chiles.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Place each chicken breast, smooth-side-up, on a work surface.
Place the palm of one hand on top of one breast, then insert a pairing knife to make a length-wise pocket in each breast.
Divide the cheese filling between the breasts, stuffing them full.
Rub the chicken with the oil, then season all over with 3/4 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper.
Preheat the oven to 425F.
Place the chicken breasts on an oiled baking sheet and bake until cooked through, about 30 minutes.
Let stand 5 minutes before slicing and serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
3. In a small bowl, mix the shredded cheddar and drained hatch chiles.
4. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
5. Add the chicken breasts to the skillet and cook until browned on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.
6. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
7. Add the cheddar and hatch chile mixture to the skillet and cook until melted and combined.
8. Add the chicken breasts back to the skillet and stir to coat the chicken evenly with the cheese and chile mixture.
9. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Remove the skillet from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Take a 16 oz.
glass and fill it up approx.
2/3 full with the crushed ice.
Pour in the rum.
Slowly pour in the cream soda it may fizz up a bit.
Drink with Straw, Enjoy.
"Pleasedon't Drink and Drive".
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine 30 ml of Captain Morgan Spiced Rum, 1 cup of cream soda, and 1 cup of crushed ice.
2. Stir the mixture until the ice is fully melted and the ingredients are well combined.
3. Pour the mixture into a tall glass filled with ice.
4. Garnish the drink with a sprig of mint or a lemon wedge, if desired.
5. Enjoy your delicious Hard Rock Candy, Alcoholic Beverage!

This recipe combines the smooth and spiced flavor of Captain Morgan Spiced Rum with the refreshing taste of cream soda and the cooling effect of crushed ice. The result is a delightful and refreshing Hard Rock Candy, Alcoholic Beverage that is perfect for a hot summer day or any occasion where you want to enjoy a delicious and unique drink.

gt:
Scrub the potatoes and make shallow cuts around their middles to make it easier to cut them in half after baking.
Bake the potatoes at 400 degrees until soft, usually 1 hour, depending on size of potatoes.
Meanwhile, cut the ends from the stalks of broccoli and peel some of the outer skin off to make the stems more edible.
Steam the broccoli until crunchy-tender and bright green.
Drain and chop fine.
Cut potatoes in half and scoop out the insides into a bowl.
Add the salt, olive oil and just enough rice or soy milk to allow you to mash the potatoes into a smooth paste.
Add the Parmesan cheese and the chopped broccoli and mix well.
Pile the mixture back into the potato shells, arrange on a baking dish and heat them to desired temperature.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Wash and peel the potatoes, then cut them into even-sized pieces.
3. In a large bowl, mix the potatoes, broccoli, salt, and olive oil.
4. Add rice milk or soymilk, and mix well to combine.
5. Stir in the grated parmesan cheese.
6. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
7. Place the potato mixture on the prepared baking sheet, and shape it into a flat, even layer.
8. Bake the stuffed potatoes in the preheated oven for 45-60 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the filling is hot and bubbly.
9. Remove the baking sheet from the oven, and let the stuffed potatoes cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

[INST]

In summary, to make Stuffed Potatoes, you will need 3 large baking potatoes, 3 stalks broccoli, 12 teaspoon salt, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 -2 tablespoon rice milk or 1 -2 tablespoon soymilk, and 2 tablespoons grated parmesan cheese. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C), wash and peel the potatoes, cut them into even-sized pieces, mix the ingredients in a large bowl, shape the mixture into a flat layer, and bake the stuffed potatoes in the oven for 45-60 minutes. Let the potatoes cool for a few minutes before serving. Enjoy your delicious Stuffed Potatoes!

gt:
In a 4 cup microwave safe glass container combine dry stuff, then stir in the wet stuff.
Cook on high for 2 minutes, then whisk the mixture.
Cook on high one more minute at a time, whisking after each minute, until thickened.
Once it's almost thick, you should go for 15- 30 seconds at a time.
Allow to cool if you can wait!
pred:
[/INST]

1. In a microwave-safe bowl, combine the cornstarch and sugar.
2. Add the milk and cocoa powder, and mix well.
3. Microwave the mixture on high for 2 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds.
4. Add the vanilla extract and continue to microwave for an additional 1 minute, stirring every 30 seconds.
5. The mixture should be smooth and creamy. If it's too thick, add a bit more milk. If it's too thin, add a bit more cornstarch.
6. Pour the pudding into a microwave-safe container and microwave for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until it reaches the desired consistency.
7. Cool the pudding for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your Super Fast and Easy Microwave Chocolate Pudding!

gt:
Combine milk, pumpkin, rice, sugar, cinnamon, ginger, salt and cloves to a boil in a large saucepan.
Stir mixture constantly.
Reduce heat to low; simmer 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove pan from heat.
Beat eggs and vanilla in a large bowl.
Slowly stir in hot pumpkin mixture, blending well after each addition.
(This lowers the temperature of the mixture, you don't want to add it at once, because you might end up with scrambled eggs.
Not very appetizing!
Or just whisk some of the hot mixture into the eggs.
Then pour all into the hot mixture.)
Pour into greased 2 quart casserole.
Bake at 375 F for 45 to 50 minutes or until pudding is set.
Cool slightly.
Serve warm or refrigerate until ready to serve.
Garnish as desired.
Dollop of whipped cream, dash of cinnamon, maybe.
Put leftovers in the refrigerator.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the milk, pumpkin, and rice.
3. Add the sugar, cinnamon, ginger, salt, and cloves to the mixture.
4. Whisk the eggs and vanilla extract together and pour them into the bowl.
5. Mix the ingredients together until well combined.
6. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the pudding is set and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
8. Allow the pudding to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Baked Pumpkin Rice Pudding!

gt:
Place a dry nonstick or cast-iron skillet over medium heat.
Roast unpeeled garlic cloves and chilies, turning frequently, until soft, about 10 minutes for the chilies and 15 minutes for the garlic.
Cool, then remove skins from garlic and stems from chilies.
In a food processor, combine chilies, garlic, cilantro, parsley, olive oil and salt.
Process until nearly smooth.
Cover the herb paste and refrigerate until needed.
To finish ceviche: In a large bowl, whisk together the lime juice and 1/2 cup of herb paste.
Add fish and cucumber, and stir to combine.
Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes (or up to an hour).
Transfer remaining herb paste to a jar, cover with a film of oil, refrigerate and save for another use, like stirring into eggs or smearing on chicken before roasting or grilling.
Taste and season with additional lime juice or salt as desired.
Gently fold in most of the avocado, reserving a few cubes as a garnish.
Line plates or cocktail glasses with lettuce leaves, and top with ceviche and remaining avocado.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the garlic cloves, chilies, cilantro, parsley, olive oil, salt, and lime juice. Stir to combine.
3. Add the fish cubes to the bowl and toss to coat the fish in the marinade. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.
4. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
5. Spread the fish mixture evenly over the prepared baking sheet.
6. Roast the fish in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until it is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
7. Remove the fish from the oven and let it cool slightly.
8. In a blender, combine the avocado flesh, cucumber, and tender lettuce leaves. Blend until smooth and creamy.
9. Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a large bowl.
10. Stir in the cooked fish and adjust the seasoning with salt and lime juice, if needed.
11. Serve the Green Ceviche With Cucumber in bowls, garnished with additional cilantro and parsley leaves.

[/INST]

gt:
Mix pudding and coffee granules in small dessert dish.
Refrigerate 10 min.
Top with wafers and whipped topping.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Jell-O pudding mix and the instant coffee. Whisk until smooth.
2. Add the Nilla vanilla wafers to the mixture and stir until they are evenly coated.
3. Pour the mixture into individual cups or ramekins.
4. Refrigerate the cups for at least 2 hours or until set.
5. Once set, top each cup with a dollop of Cool Whip.
6. Refrigerate the cups for at least 30 minutes or until the Cool Whip is firm.
7. Serve the Easy Tiramisu Cup immediately.

[/INST]

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Jell-O pudding mix and the instant coffee. Whisk until smooth.
2. Add the Nilla vanilla wafers to the mixture and stir until they are evenly coated.
3. Pour the mixture into individual cups or ramekins.
4. Refrigerate the cups for at least 2 hours or until set.
5. Once set, top each cup with a dollop of Cool Whip.
6. Refrigerate the cups for at least 30 minutes or until the Cool Whip is firm.
7. Serve the Easy Tiramisu Cup immediately.

gt:
Heat oven to 375 degrees F.
Stir together Bisquick mix, milk and nutmeg in ungreased square baking dish, 8x8x2 inches.
Stir in butter until blended.
Stir together sugar and peaches; spoon over batter.
Bake 50 to 60 minutes or until golden.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 1 cup of milk, 1/2 teaspoon of ground nutmeg, and the melted butter or margarine. Whisk until smooth.
3. Add the 1 cup of Bisquick mix to the wet ingredients and mix until well combined.
4. Pour the batter into a greased 9-inch (23cm) square baking dish.
5. Arrange the sliced peaches evenly over the batter.
6. Drizzle the remaining 1/2 cup of sugar over the peaches.
7. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until the cobbler is golden brown and the peaches are tender.
8. Allow the cobbler to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Classic BisquickTM Peach Cobbler!

gt:
1.
Preheat oven to 250 degrees F.
2.
Combine chex, pretzels, and peanuts in a baking pan with high edges.
3.
In a small bowl combine the oil, Worcestershire sauce, and liquid smoke.
Combine remaining dry ingredients (sugar, garlic and onion powders, dry mustard powder, cayenne pepper, salt) in another small bowl.
4.
Add the wet ingredients to the baking dish and stir well, until the chex, pretzels, and peanuts are coated.
Next, add the dry ingredients and stir again until the mixture has an even coating.
5.
Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes.
6.
Serve hot or at room temperature.
Store in an airtight container.
Adapted from a recipe on the back of a Crispix box from the 1990s.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 250°F (120°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the Corn Chex Cereal, Pretzels, Peanuts, and Olive Oil. Mix well to ensure all ingredients are evenly coated.
3. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet or a lined baking sheet.
4. Roast the mixture in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the Chex are golden brown and the Pretzels are crispy.
5. While the Chex and Pretzels are roasting, prepare the sauce by combining the Worcestershire Sauce, Liquid Smoke Hickory Flavor, Granulated Sugar, Garlic Powder, Onion Powder, Dry Mustard Powder, Cayenne Pepper, and Salt in a small bowl.
6. Once the Chex and Pretzels are cooked, remove them from the oven and pour the sauce mixture over the top. Stir to combine.
7. Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes before serving.

This delightful BBQ Chex Mix dish is a delicious and easy-to-prepare snack that combines the crunchy texture of the Chex and Pretzels with the smoky flavor of the BBQ sauce. The combination of ingredients creates a satisfying and flavorful treat that can be enjoyed at parties, gatherings, or as a simple, homemade snack.

gt:
Peel cucumbers and cut to your liking.
You can cut the cucumber in half, then in long strips lengthwise, or simply cut them in rounds.
Totally up to you.
I like my in think rounds.
Place cucumbers and onions in a stainless steel bowl large enough for all the ingredients.
Put all the ingredients EXCEPT the cucumbers and onions in a saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat.
Pour vinegar mixture over the cucumbers and onions; cover bowl tightly wth aluminum foil or plastic wrap and leave out on counter to cool.
Once cool, refrigerate cucumbers overnight.
Before serving, pour off the vinegar mixture and remove peppercorns.
pred:
1. Wash and peel the cucumbers, then slice them into thin rounds.
2. In a large bowl, combine the sliced cucumbers, red onion, and peppercorns.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the white wine vinegar, dill, sage (if using), lemon juice, and sugar.
4. Pour the vinegar mixture over the cucumber mixture, and stir to combine.
5. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
6. After the pickling mixture has been chilling, remove it from the refrigerator and let it sit at room temperature for about 30 minutes.
7. Drain the pickling mixture, reserving the liquid.
8. Pack the pickled cucumbers into clean jars, leaving 1/2 inch of headspace.
9. Pour the reserved pickling liquid over the cucumbers in the jars.
10. Close the jars with lids, and store them in the refrigerator for at least 24 hours before serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Heat oven to 375F.
Mix flour and baking soda until blended.
Beat butter and sugars in large bowl with mixer until light and fluffy.
Blend in eggs and vanilla.
Gradually add flour mixture, beating well after each addition.
Stir in remaining ingredients.
Drop tablespoonfuls of dough, 2 inches apart, onto baking sheets sprayed with cooking spray.
Bake 8 to 10 min.
or until lightly browned.
Cool on baking sheets 3 min.
Remove to wire racks; cool completely.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Chocolate Chunk-Everything Cookies dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. Stir in the vanilla extract.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and granulated sugar.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
7. Fold in the chopped chocolate, crisp rice cereal, old-fashioned oats, chopped toasted pecans, and chopped pretzels.
8. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden.
10. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Chocolate Chunk-Everything Cookies!

gt:
Whip the cream cheese and 2 tablespoons of sugar until creamy, add more sugar if u would like and whip until sugar is dissolved
Combine crushed graham crackers with 1 tablespoon of sugar, like u would do for pie crust.
Add all the ingredients together.
Form into little balls and dipping in chocolate or even put a chocolate chip inside...
I just eat them like little poppers
Put them in the fridge until chilled and enjoy.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 300°F (150°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the cream cheese and sugar together until smooth and fluffy.
3. Add the crushed graham crackers and mix until well combined.
4. If the mixture is too dry, you can add a bit more cream cheese or sugar to achieve the desired consistency.
5. Roll the mixture into small balls using a cookie scoop or your hands.
6. Place the balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake the cheesecake balls in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the edges are slightly golden.
8. Allow the cheesecake balls to cool completely before serving.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
Please note that the above recipe is a general guideline and may vary depending on individual preferences and dietary requirements. Feel free to modify the ingredients or baking time to suit your needs.

gt:
The key is a flavorful stock - refer to my stock recipes for tips if needed - store bought may be resorted to and my tip would be low sodium - low fat - College Inn or Swansons.
In a large soup pot add 1 tbsp olive oil - add the first 4 ingredients and saute till onions are clear.
Add mushrooms and add salt and pepper to taste.
Add bay leaves, herbs, stock and simmer over medium heat for 45 minutes.
Add remaining ingredients, including shells cook for 10-15 minutes (add a cup or two of water if you think the soup is to thick - the shells do take up some moisture as they are cooked into the soup) and remove from heat - serve with a slice of crusty bread and some fresh grated parmesan cheese.
pred:
[INST]To create a delicious Vegetables and Small Shells Soup, follow these steps:
1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat oil over medium heat. Add the diced onions, carrot, and celery, and cook until the vegetables are tender.
2. Add the minced garlic and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.
3. Add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they are softened.
4. Pour in the chicken or turkey stock, along with the bay leaves and Italian seasoning. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 30 minutes.
5. Add the diced tomatoes, corn, zucchini, cannellini beans, and red kidney beans to the pot. Stir to combine.
6. Cook the soup for an additional 20-25 minutes or until the vegetables are tender and the flavors have melded together.
7. Add the pasta (small shells) to the pot and stir to combine. Cook the pasta until it is cooked through and tender.
8. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Serve the Vegetables and Small Shells Soup hot, garnished with fresh basil leaves if desired.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat oven to 375F Spray 8x8-inch glass baking dish with cooking spray.
Place spinach in microwave-safe bowl.
Cover with plastic wrap and microwave on HIGH 2 minutes; squeeze spinach dry.
Combine ravioli, drained tomatoes and Italian seasoning in medium microwave-safe bowl.
Cover with plastic wrap and microwave on HIGH 3 to 4 minutes or until mixture is hot.
Combine cottage cheese, spinach and black pepper in small bowl.
Place half of ravioli mixture in bottom of baking dish.
Top with half of cottage cheese mixture and 1/2 cup shredded cheese.
Repeat layers.
Bake 15 minutes or until cheese is hot and bubbly.
COOK'S TIP: Involve the kids with the preparation.
They can stir together the cottage cheese mixture and help layer the ingredients in the dish.
Trying to please a picky eater?
Substitute the spinach with another vegetable the family enjoys.
You also could place all of the spinach mixture between the layers of ravioli or leave the spinach out completely.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the PAM Original No-Stick Cooking Spray, drained well, and the 1 cup of shredded Italian cheese blend. Mix until well combined.
3. In a separate bowl, combine the 1 cup of 1% low fat cottage cheese, 12 teaspoons of dried Italian seasoning, and the ground black pepper. Mix until well combined.
4. In a large baking dish, spread a layer of the PAM and cheese mixture evenly across the bottom.
5. Place the 12 teaspoons of dried Italian seasoning and the 1 cup of shredded Italian cheese blend on top of the PAM and cheese mixture.
6. Place the 15 ounce can of Hunt's Diced Tomatoes on top of the seasoning mixture.
7. Carefully place the 14 1/2 ounce can of Chef Boyardee Beef Ravioli on top of the tomatoes.
8. Pour the 12 teaspoons of dried Italian seasoning and the 1 cup of 1% low fat cottage cheese mixture over the ravioli.
9. Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake for 25-30 minutes or until the ravioli is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Remove the foil and let the lasagna cool for a few minutes before serving.

This recipe for Chef Boyardee Ravioli Lasagna combines the convenience of using pre-made ravioli with the rich flavors of traditional Italian ingredients. The PAM Original No-Stick Cooking Spray ensures that the lasagna does not stick to the baking dish, while the shredded Italian cheese blend and dried Italian seasoning add depth and complexity to the dish. The combination of these ingredients results in a delicious and satisfying lasagna that can be enjoyed by the whole family.

gt:
Preheat the oven on 250F.
In a basin cut the tender tops of the cauliflower and clean them with water.
Mix all ingredients in the basin and cook in the oven for 45 minutes
Every 10-15 minutes stir everything.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Cut the cauliflower into florets and place them in a large mixing bowl.
3. Add the olive oil and honey to the bowl, and toss the cauliflower to coat evenly.
4. Add the curry powder to the bowl, and toss the cauliflower to ensure it is evenly coated with the spice.
5. Add a pinch of salt to the bowl, and toss the cauliflower again to combine all the ingredients.
6. Transfer the cauliflower mixture to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Roast the cauliflower in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until it is tender and slightly caramelized.
8. Remove the cauliflower from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Serve the cauliflower with a drizzle of honey and a sprinkle of curry powder, if desired.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Mix first 4 ingredients until blended.
Whisk egg, milk and oil in medium bowl until blended.
Stir in flour mixture.
Ladle batter onto hot griddle or into hot skillet sprayed with cooking spray, using about 1 Tbsp.
batter for each pancake; cook until bubbles form on tops, then turn to brown other sides.
Stack pancakes in 10 piles on platter.
Top each stack with piece of fruit; secure with toothpick.
Sift icing sugar over pancakes.
Top with Cool Whip.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, granulated sugar, Magic Baking Powder, and salt.
3. Add the egg, milk, and oil, and mix until smooth.
4. Stir in the strawberries, pineapple, kiwi, and icing sugar.
5. Pour the batter into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
6. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the pancake comes out clean.
7. Allow the pancakes to cool for a few minutes before cutting them into desired stacks.
8. Once the pancakes are cooled, place a spoonful of Cool Whip Whipped Topping on top of each stack.

Enjoy your delicious Mini Pancake Stacks!

gt:
Mix the French onion spread ingredients and chill in the fridge for an hour.
Once the spread has been chilled, roll out a long piece of foil and lay the tortillas on the foil so that the ends of the tortillas overlap on the inside.
Generously spread the French Onion mixture over the tortillas.
Try to cover as much of the surface as possible.
Place the slices of roast beef down the middle of the tortillas.
Overlap them so it is like one continuous strip of roast beef.
Roll the tortillas carefully and tightly.
Cover the rolled tortilla with the surrounding foil.
Be careful to make sure the ends are sealed.
Chill in the fridge for a few hours or overnight.
Take out and slice the big roll into smaller pieces.
pred:
1. First, preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Spread the sour cream evenly on one side of each tortilla.
3. Place the roast beef slices on top of the sour cream, leaving a small border around the edges.
4. Spread the light mayonnaise evenly over the roast beef.
5. Roll up the tortillas, enclosing the roast beef and mayonnaise mixture.
6. Place the rolled tortillas on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake the rollups in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the tortillas are golden brown and the filling is hot and bubbly.
