4. Dip each string cheese stick into the beaten eggs, then coat it with the bread crumb mixture.
5. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
6. Carefully place the breaded cheese sticks into the hot oil, being careful not to overcrowd the pan.
7. Cook the sticks for about 3-4 minutes, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
8. Remove the sticks from the oil using a slotted spoon or tongs, and place them on a wire rack to drain.
9. While the sticks are cooking, prepare the tomato sauce by heating it in a saucepan over medium heat.
10. Once the sticks are cooked, place them in the oven to melt the cheese and warm them through.
11. Serve the Homemade Mozzarella Sticks with the tomato sauce for dipping.

Enjoy your delicious Homemade Mozzarella Sticks!

gt:
in large frying pan saute with olive oil - thinly sliced onion & thinly sliced garlic until lightly blanched.
add sausage & ground beef.
saute until sausage & beef are braised.
add some wine.
transfer to a large pan.
add halved cherry tomatoes & sliced zucchini.
saute until tomatoes begin to wrinkle.
add V8 & allow to reach a simmer.
add pesto, oregano & thyme.
reduce to level of a thin sauce.
add corn starch & thicken.
add more wine.
last add parsley & chives.
season with salt & fresh pepper.
reduce to sauce thickness (if it needs liquid add more white wine).
Allow to cool & refrigerate overnight for flavors to be infused in the sauce.
Serve over al dente pasta and top with grated romano cheese.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until it is browned and cooked through. Season the beef with salt and pepper to taste.
3. In a large pot, combine the sliced kielbasa, V8 vegetable juice, cornstarch, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the sauce thickens.
4. In a separate large skillet, cook the sliced onion and garlic over medium heat until the onion is softened.
5. Add the cooked ground beef to the onion and garlic mixture, and stir to combine.
6. Add the sliced zucchini and cook until they are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
7. Add the cooked kielbasa sauce to the zucchini mixture, stirring to combine.
8. Add the sliced cherry tomatoes, pesto sauce, parsley, chives, oregano, thyme, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Stir to combine.
9. Cook the mixture over medium heat for about 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce is heated through and the flavors are well combined.
10. Serve the My Homemade Spaghetti Sauce over cooked spaghetti, and enjoy your delicious homemade meal.

gt:
Brown beef in skillet.
Drain grease.
Combine remaining ingredients and pour over beef.
Mix well.
Simmer slowly for 10 to 15 minutes.
Serve on your choice of rolls.
(I like onion or potato rolls with this).
pred:
1. Begin by preheating your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pot, cook the ground beef over medium heat until it is browned and cooked through.
3. Add the catsup, water, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, sugar, and hot sauce to the skillet or pot. Stir to combine.
4. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. While the sauce is simmering, prepare the sandwich buns by spreading them with butter or mayonnaise.
6. Once the sauce has cooked for 30 minutes, use a slotted spoon to transfer the sauce to a large oven-safe dish.
7. Place the dish in the preheated oven and bake for about 15-20 minutes, or until the sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened.
8. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Use a spatula to carefully transfer the sauce to the prepared sandwich buns.
10. Serve the My Husband Calls This BBQ (Sloppy Joes) immediately.

Enjoy your delicious homemade My Husband Calls This BBQ (Sloppy Joes) dish!

gt:
Combine all ingredients (can use electric hand mixer) and shape into ball.
Refrigerate, but let set out at room temperature before serving.
Serve with crackers.
pred:
To cook a delicious Sharp Cheddar Cheese Ball dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix together the cream cheese, sharp cheddar cheese, shredded, and French onion dip until well combined.
3. Add the Worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, and parsley flakes to the mixture, and stir to combine.
4. In a separate bowl, mix together the onion powder, garlic powder, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
5. Roll the mixture into small balls, about the size of a walnut.
6. Place the balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake the cheese balls in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
8. Remove the cheese balls from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Sharp Cheddar Cheese Ball dish!

gt:
Combine mince, egg, breadcrumbs, sauce, parsley, onion and garlic.
Mix well to combine.
Lightly press half the mixture into the base of a foil-lined 10x20cm loaf tin.
Top with tomatoes, cheese & basil.Lightly press remaining mince mixture over this and smooth top.
Bake at 200.C for about 1 hour or until cooked through.
About 10 mins before the end of coooking you can spread some extra sauce on top if you like.
Remove from tin & serve sliced with vegies or salad.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large bowl, mix the minced steak or ground beef, egg, breadcrumbs, chopped onion, chopped garlic, and chopped parsley. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Shape the mixture into a loaf shape, and place it on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
4. Bake the meatloaf in the preheated oven for about 1 hour or until it reaches an internal temperature of 160°C (320°F).
5. Remove the meatloaf from the oven, and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into portions.
6. If desired, serve the meatloaf with extra tomato sauce or pasta sauce, and garnish with sliced mozzarella cheese and fresh basil leaves.

Enjoy your delicious Italian Meatloaf!

gt:
Pour your favorite vodka in a glass jar.
Slice each vanilla bean and add to vodka
Let it sit in a cool, dark, dry place for about two months or longer.
Allow to sit longer to your desired flavor
Add more vanilla beans and vodka to replace and to add more vanilla flavor
pred:
[INST] <<SYS>>
To prepare Vanilla extract, follow these steps:
1. Gather the necessary ingredients: 5 cups of favorite vodka and 6 vanilla beans.
2. Crush the vanilla beans using a mortar and pestle or a food processor.
3. Add the crushed vanilla beans to the vodka, ensuring that they are fully submerged.
4. Store the mixture in a dark, cool place for at least 2 weeks, shaking it occasionally.
5. After 2 weeks, strain the mixture through a cheesecloth or a fine-mesh sieve, discarding the vanilla beans.
6. Store the Vanilla extract in a clean, dark, and cool place for up to 6 months.

Please note that this is a general guide, and the actual time it takes for the Vanilla extract to mature may vary depending on factors such as the quality of the ingredients and the storage conditions.

gt:
Mix yeast, warm water and sugar together in a large bowl.
Set aside for five minutes, or until mixture becomes foamy.
Stir in olive oil, lemon, salt, rosemary, garlic, onion, cheese and 3 cups flour into the yeast mixture.
Gradually mix in next three cups of flour.
(Dough will be stiff).
Knead for 5 to 10 minutes, or until it is smooth and elastic.
Place in an oiled bowl, turning to cover sides with oil.
Cover with a towel, or plastic wrap.
Let rise for 1 hour, or until dough has doubled.
Punch down to release all the air.
Shape into a ball.
Place in a greased ceramic stoneware, or into two 9x5 inch, greased pans.
Allow to rise for 1/2 hour again, until doubled in a warm place.
Bake at 350 degrees for 2 loaves, 30 minutes, for one loaf, 40 minutes.
Remove loaves from pans and let cool on wire racks for at least 15 minutes, before slicing.
pred:
To create a delightful Rosemary Artisan Bread dish, follow these steps:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine 1 tablespoon dry yeast, 2 cups water, 2 tablespoons sugar, and 14 cup olive oil. Stir until the yeast is fully dissolved.
2. Add 1 tablespoon sea salt, 2 tablespoons fresh rosemary, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1 teaspoon instant minced garlic, and 1 teaspoon dried onion flakes. Mix well.
3. Gradually add 12 cup freshly grated pecorino romano cheese, stirring to combine.
4. In a separate bowl, combine 6 cups all-purpose flour. Slowly add the flour mixture to the wet ingredients, stirring until a dough forms.
5. Knead the dough on a floured surface until smooth and elastic, about 10-15 minutes.
6. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a damp cloth or plastic wrap, and let it rise in a warm, draft-free place for about 1-2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.
7. Preheat your oven to 450°F (232°C).
8. Punch down the dough and transfer it to a lightly floured surface. Shape the dough into a ball and then divide it into 2 equal portions.
9. On a lightly floured surface, roll out one portion of the dough into a 12-inch (30 cm) long rope. Place it on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Brush the rope with olive oil and sprinkle it with a pinch of salt.
11. Using a sharp knife, cut the rope into 12 equal pieces.
12. Place the pieces on the prepared baking sheet, spacing them about 2 inches (5 cm) apart.
13. Cover the baking sheet with a damp cloth or plastic wrap, and let the bread rise for about 30 minutes

gt:
Combine all ingredients in large bowl except dressing.
Drizzle with dressing just before serving; mix lightly.
pred:

1. In a large bowl, combine the chopped kale, carrot, red pepper, and red onions.
2. In a small bowl, whisk together the chopped cilantro, Kraft Mandarin Orange with Sesame Dressing, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
3. Pour the dressing mixture over the kale mixture and toss to combine.
4. Serve immediately or refrigerate for later use.

This Kale Salad recipe is a delicious and nutritious meal option that incorporates a variety of ingredients to create a flavorful and visually appealing dish. The combination of the crunchy kale, tender carrot, and vibrant red pepper and onion adds a delightful contrast of textures and colors to the dish. The addition of the fresh cilantro and the tangy dressing from the Kraft Mandarin Orange with Sesame Dressing not only enhances the taste but also adds a refreshing touch to the salad. This salad is perfect for a light lunch or a side dish to accompany any meal.

gt:
Pour olive oil on chicken
Mix the spices then rub over the chicken.
Leave for fifteen minutes.
Season the chicken from the inside with salt and pepper.
Add bacon then whole lemon.
Roast on charcoal for best flavor.
One and half hour.
Turning every twenty minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the paprika, turmeric, cumin, black pepper, and salt.
3. Rinse the chicken and pat it dry.
4. Place the chicken in a large roasting pan.
5. Drizzle the olive oil over the chicken and toss to coat it evenly.
6. Spread the spice mixture evenly over the chicken.
7. Add the chopped bacon on top of the chicken.
8. Place the lemon on top of the chicken.
9. Roast the chicken in the preheated oven for about 1-1.5 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
10. Remove the chicken from the oven, let it rest for a few minutes, and then slice it into pieces.
11. Serve the roasted chicken with the lemon wedges and any desired side dishes.

gt:
Preheat oven to 425F 2.
Toss the turnips carrots, parsnips, and garlic in a bowl with a generous splash of olive oil and salt and pepper.
Spread them out in an even layer on a baking sheet and roast them for about 10 minutes, then toss them once (if tossed more frequently, they tend to break apart as they become tender).
Roast for 5 minutes more and check for doneness - depending on the water content of the veggies, they can take from 15 to 30 minutes.
The turnips are done when they are fork tender and nicely caramelized.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, toss the quartered turnips, carrots, and parsnips with olive oil, salt, and fresh ground black pepper.
3. Spread the vegetables out on a baking sheet or roasting pan, ensuring they are evenly spaced.
4. Roast the vegetables in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
5. While the vegetables are roasting, heat a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the crushed garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
6. Carefully pour the hot garlic mixture over the roasted vegetables, tossing to coat evenly.
7. Return the vegetables to the oven and continue roasting for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the garlic mixture has melted and the vegetables are fully caramelized.
8. Remove the vegetables from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
9. Serve the caramelized turnips, carrots, and parsnips as a side dish or as part of a larger meal.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.
Cream the butter and sugars until light and fluffy.
Add the molasses, egg, and vanilla extract and beat until incorporated.
In a separate bowl whisk together the flour, baking soda, salt, and spices.
Add to the butter mixture and mix until well combined.
Cover and chill the batter for about 30 minutes.
Place about 1 cup sugar in a medium sized bowl.
When the dough has chilled sufficiently, roll into 1 inch balls.
Then roll the balls of dough into the sugar, coating them thoroughly.
Place on the baking sheet, spacing about 2 inches apart and, with the bottom of a glass, flatten the cookies slightly.
Bake for about 12 - 15 minutes or until the cookies feel dry and firm on top.
Cool on a wire rack.
pred:
To make delicious Gingersnaps, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the molasses, egg, vanilla extract, and mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the dry ingredients (flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ginger, and cloves) to the wet ingredients, mixing until a smooth dough forms.
5. On a floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
6. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
7. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the cookies for 8-10 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
9. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Gingersnaps!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Grease a 13"x9" baking pan.
Reserve 2/3 cup cake mix; set aside.
For the crust: in a large mixing bowl, stir together remaining cake mix, melted butter and 1 egg until thoroughly blended (mixture will be crumbly).
Press mixture evenly into bottom of prepared pan.
Bake until light golden brown (15-20 minutes).
In a large mixing bowl, combine reserved cake mix, maple syrup, remaining 3 eggs, sugar and vanilla extract; beat at low speed of electric mixer for 3 minutes.
Pour over crust.
Sprinkle with walnuts.
Bake until filling is set (30-35 minutes).
Cool completely in pan.
Cut into bars to serve, and store any extras in refrigerator.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking dish.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the melted butter, eggs, and maple syrup. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the dry cake mix, chopped walnuts, and vanilla extract. Mix until well combined.
4. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish.
5. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
6. Allow the bars to cool completely before cutting into squares and serving.

mix chopped onions, jalapenos, mushrooms, and tomatoes with browned sausage
stuff peppers with mixture and top with cheese
bake in oven for 20 minutes at 350 F or until cheese is brown and bubbly

mix well
mix the flour and baking powder well, and put in the banana mixture, mix well.

gt:

Remove from oven.
Once cool, slice tenderloins into strips.
Lay lettuce cups flat.
You are going to fill them as if they are tacos.
Spread Greek yogurt in a strip down the middle.
Divide chicken strips evenly among lettuce cups.
Divide grapefruit evenly among the lettuce cups.
Sprinkle with almonds and mint.
Enjoy.
